rFHBPvcAqQ5MfqdzLmyilg.text: This was my first time trying out Midwood Smokehouse.  I'm a huge fan of North Carolina BBQ with the eastern NC vinegar based sauce.  Service was great. I was seated quickly. The waitress asked if it was my first time visiting and went into detail about how they are known for their brisket, that they make all of their own sauces and dressings from scratch, and they have a special smoker.  It was a Tuesday night so they also had a $3 special on all NC beers.  I will say their drink menu was lacking and confusing.  Instead of naming the specific beers they were on tap, it just named the breweries that they had beers from. We all know there are lots of breweries in charlotte with a wide selection of choices.  It would have been beneficial to be able to see which specific beer they were serving from that brewery and a description. (Not everyone is super familiar with what each local beer brewed is) I ordered the brisket sandwich with a side of coleslaw. You had a choice of which type of cheese you could put on your sandwich and I chose the pimento. You couldn't even taste the pimento cheese on the sandwich.  It was my first time trying brisket and I won't be trying it again. It was served on a basic piece of toast.  I only ate half the sandwich because it really was disappointing.  The coleslaw was terrible. I really had high hopes for this restaurant and would like to go back and try something else but I just don't know if I will since there are other BBQ places I have already tried that I know are better. I will say the waitress was fantastic and the food was served promptly. If I go back and try something else I will update my review. Until then, I wouldn't recommend this place.

nTbPaHk2YOlo9nymuW7r7A.text: Am pretty pleased with this place.  They have beef brisket...hard to find in the land of pork.  The pork is also very good.  It is always crowded so avoid prime times for coming here.  And it is loud and busy.  If you have a senior with a walker or wheelchair they can accommodate, but it really gets in their way and to their credit the staff work around it.  I like their appetizers which include jalapenos stuffed with cheese and fried.  We had an order and they just were not cooked well.  Told the wait person and very quickly the manager came to deliver a fresh, perfectly made order to our table.  THAT is excellent customer service and satisfaction.  You can order mixed portions of meats and can also select fatty or lean brisket.  Or a mix of the two.    They really do aim to please.    97 year old Dad likes their mac & cheese and we found the staff more than willing to customize portions and selections for him rather than just stick to what the menu dictates.  Parking is also crowded, but somehow the lot outside does accommodate.  This is a good BBQ joint.

mBpzrdTWeDrB3vouc3K5CQ.text: This place is amazing, best bbq in North Carolina!! Highly recommend! The Brisket is top notch!!

-FaxE78Hv6bp_5_LfzO1tQ.text: Now I can't believe I haven't left a review here... this place is one of the better smokehouses around there are a lot of things that I've tried here but I went for lunch this past week and tried their, I think it was "pitmaster's choice", burger and holy moly it was to die for. Shaved beef brisket with a patty (medium well for me), gouda cheese, some type of Chipotle sauce I can't remember, banana peppers, and a lot more. Right when it was put in front of me you could just smell it and it tasted even better than it smelled. I've also had some of their meats, sausage, ribs, just about all of them and I can't complain about any of them. Hush puppies are amazing, Mac and cheese is amazing, baked beans amazing. Oh and did I mention the BBQ sauces? Those are... amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

RwvAZ6RrSmEzHOiehKqD3Q.text: Outstanding! Great service, great food. I had the brisket (fatty, not lean!), sausage, sweet potato fries, baked beans. Brisket was awesome, but everything was good.  Waitress (Erin) was excellent.  Recommended!

lmyRfm9QeP5v7Av67XTJeQ.text: We got so much food here. It's a good spot for bbq, and worth trying if you're in the area.  Bacon wrapped Jalapenos - So I'm probably not the target demographic for this since I hate cheese and bacon, but I think if I liked those two items, I probably would have liked this.  Smoked wings - I liked the smoked version better than the crispy version. Actually had a nice smokey flavor. Although I'd probably skip the wings in favor of some of the other bbq options.  Burnt Ends - I wasn't the biggest fans of these, but some others in my party loved them. I guess it just depends on if you like this kind of stuff. I was honestly expecting it to be more crispy, but I've never had burnt ends before, so no point of comparison. Also not a huge fan of BBQ sauce in general, which was the main flavor component for this dish.  St Louis Style Pork Ribs - THESE WERE SO GOOD. Very tender and flavorful. You have to get this.  Beef Brisket - I thought that this was okay, but not spectacular.   Carolina Pork - I really liked this too, very flavorful and tender.   Hickory Smoked Sausage - Not bad, although I feel like ribs are just always going to be better than sausage.   The hush puppies and pickled onions were also great accompaniments to the meat. We got a couple of side dishes, and I quite liked the smoked veggies (although they were a bit too oily for me). The banana pudding was also quite good, though very rich. All in all, enjoyed the meal here, and I think I prefer it to City Barbecue, solely on the strength of its ribs and Carolina Pork (although admittedly they are different styles).

wHczeIoeYrLo6T5w7uvgkw.text: Let's be honest - I have only had the brisket and the burnt ends. But they keep me full, happy, and coming back for more.  This Ballantyne location has done very well. The staff is friendly, the food is hot and consistently good. The mac and cheese is amazing too - some days I could just get a whole plate of that and fade happily into a food coma.   The restaurant is set up with a bar towards the front, so you don't feel awkward buzzing past the host stand to get to the bar. There are tables and booths everywhere, and they even have a little patio outside. They've made this into a very comfortable, casual place to come and have dinner. You could come with the family, or grab drinks with a date. You could even take food to go - but I guess that depends on how the date is going - haha!  I had friends in town from PA, and we saw the burnt ends on the list of "50 things to eat in Charlotte before you die". They weren't kidding. These are incredibly good - and most of their food pairs beautifully with the NC craft beers that they have on draught. Eventually I think I'll branch out to the other food items on the menu, but for now these choices are plenty.

A4883KWFu1eePr1ulus4oA.text: Good food.  Bad service.  Dirty glasses, long wait for service with lacking follow-through.  When I told them that my ribs were cold they didn't offer to warm them, instead  they said that the air conditioner vent above me was the reason for the cold ribs!  Cocktail refills were hard to get.  They used standard lip service to talk away the conerns rather than taking action to cure.  The manager took our glass for a wine refill and literally 10 minutes later returned with a refill.  He offered it for free because he reolised the failure in proper service.  The food tasted great.  Their service left a bad taste.  We took the ribs to go.  Went elsewhere for dessert and drinks.

3zF-VR6D3WWdxI1aZ3073Q.text: We have ordered ribs for take out many times. Told us today they are no longer taking orders for take out ribs. Ridiculous!

a8zixYwBNIX2CxjBpiNLAw.text: Great meal all around. Walter took great care of us - top notch service. Cocktails (brambleberry & jalapeno Tito's ginger beer) were delicious. The pimento cheese fries were a surprise hit for all, and great value at $6. For dinner the brisket was tender and super flavorful, the smoked vegetables were addicting, and the hushpuppies perfectly crisp on outside and soft on inside. Highly recommend.

_cXeI-PucjtCy39DxJD_Sg.text: Definitely my new favorite BBQ spot!! This was my first visit to Midwood & i joined a girlfriend for a night out! Our server Brian was just awesome! Being my first time he welcomed that & explained all the features & specials! He was so sweet , very attentive & always kept a smile on his face! We split an appetizer of the smoked wings & i will definitely be getting these again (along with the mustard base sauce)!!! We then split the carolina pork plate & had the bacon wrapped jalapenos as our side!! Sooooo good!!! Everything was just awesome! I'm looking forward to my next visit!!

TMunw3rXt3vDGBanpmwmjA.text: My entire experience was awesome!  The food was delicious and the service was on point! I kept saying I wanted to try the place and today was the day!  My coworker and I both had the midwood chopped except hers was with BBQ chicken and I had chopped pork.  We both ordered a small and it was more than enough!  For an appetizer we had the BBQ queso and it was yummy! We nibbled on that while we were eating our salads because it was so good!  Our server Amanda was awesome and really pulled together our experience.  She educated us on the menu and top sellers.  I will definitely tell others in my office and go back soon!

UENfDLZz-4HdwUw_Kvhu0Q.text: This was the first time we visited here and it was great.  We checked in ahead of time with skip the line thru yelp and it went perfectly  .  The food was great and staff great too.  The queso appetizer was awesome with pulled pork  and brisket was so tender.  In my opinion the creamed corn and Mac and cheese  sides were clean the plate good.  Not a crumb left!

dFed1WKv0ig5Vx8J87eQCQ.text: Why can't half stars be implemented? This place seriously deserve 4.5 stars but I can't give it a 5. Here's why. I've been a big fan of Mac's speed shop and I heard this place rivals Mac's and so I had to try it out. Luckily, Midwood opened a location right next to my house (yes!) so it makes commuting so much easier.  Once we walked in, we noticed how the whole restaurant is decked out with televisions. It seems like a nice place to watch the game and grab some grub. But for a Sunday night, the joint seems pretty dead. The place was only about a quarter full but I attributed that to it being a newer location. Now onward to the food:  We ordered the pimento cheese fries loaded with beef brisket and smoked wings as starters. The wings were ok but the cheese fries? Oh man, it was really good. It had the right amount of melted cheese and a generous amount of smokey brisket bits on top. The serving portion was also a lot bigger than we thought and so we already started to get a bit full before our entrees arrived. For our entrees we ordered the burnt ends with smoked veggies and a combo platter. Let me break it down for you:  The goodies: Burnt ends: the star of the night. Not many places do burnt ends (or in this case make it right) and it had the right amount of crispness on the outside and tenderness in the inside. It even got my Chinese family of 6 (that are not fans of American barbecue) fighting for that last piece.  Carolina chopped pork: moister and more tender than most BBQ joints Mac & cheese: well it's hard to mess up Mac & cheese and they definitely did not. The flavors were spot on but I wished it was a bit hotter. Bacon wrapped jalapenos: hot and spicy. Just the way I like it.  The not so goodies: Beef brisket: it was just alright but could be more tender, juicer than even a bit fattier. I thought their brisket was too lean to get that smokey flavor that brisket tends to have. St. Louis pork ribs: I've been spoiled with some good ribs and these were just alright. With the right dipping sauce they became enjoyable. Chopped chicken BBQ: too dried for my taste. I wish they offered a whole piece of chicken on the combo plate instead of shredded.  We also ordered the banana pudding and it was really good. I liked how they used actual cake bits instead of just wafers. However, the star of the show was definitely the burnt ends and that by itself made my night. I would definitely return just to order a whole large plate of burnt ends for myself alongside their vast amount of draft beers on tap.

anQTwVn995McESvProV-6Q.text: Terrible service they said they were down servers couldn't get a seat manager didn't help family just standing there.

VMIjfO3fYDELDcyZa5yepg.text: Love the food but need MUCH improvement in customer service! Arrived at 7:41 pm to order takeout. Left at 8:27 with food! No "I'm sorry" or anything from servers at takeout counter (which is where I stood ignored for most of my wait). If there was anyone "in charge" at the bar/takeout counter, they must have been on break the entire time I was there.

DUfut7XzYRe5aQ-uTLUb5A.text: Lots of good food, but avoid the beef brisket. I LOVE their pulled chicken, spicy sauce, mac & cheese, and collard greens. A "5" for those. But twice now, I have ordered food for a party, and both times the beef brisket was so fatty that guests barely ate it. NOT what you want to have happen when feeding 25 people. NOT worth $18/ pound, when it's 50% fat. The 1st time, I assumed it was a one time bad batch. But this 2nd time causes me to think that the restaurant willingly buys and serves very fatty beef brisket, at least for bulk/catering orders. Not cool.

WbXSUmGpYhIvPpGSLE-cAw.text: I am eating lunch here right now and had to stop to write this review. The Cuban is phenomenal and it is on its way to become my new favorite sandwich in Charlotte. Paired with some nice golden fries makes it a truly delectable dish. Definitely coming back!!!

2sUxGAovzldXkuzF8eVkJw.text: Mother of God the burnt ends are gooder then heck! The baked beans and mac and cheese?! Make ya wanna smack yo momma!

ytZiW2zspOTg_nx7pZJgUA.text: I used to love coming to this location but something seems to have changed in the past few months. First the food is always good here. Their burnt ends are my favorite.  The first bad experience the waitress charged my card for more than what was specified and did who knows what with the cash we gave her to go towards the bill. It took 3-4 calls to get a manager to assist me they refunded me the difference but didn't seem that concerned. I just recently visited this past Sunday and was so disappointed. When i ordered my drink it was watered down from where the tea was still warm. This caused it also to be unsweet. My waiter didnt come to check on me as I had just received my meal but couldnt eat it without a beverage. I had to ask the person bringing out drinks to help me. Because of this my food was cold. The waiter had 3-4 tables at the most so I wouldnt expect such horrible service. When i was ready to leave and asked to take my leftover meal home I was given random containers to pack it up on my own. Then when I gave the waiter cash for the bill and told him I would need change. He didnt come back with it and was trying to send me on my way. I had to let him know about the miscommunication which he didnt seem so happy about. I've taken many people out to dinner at this location but really not sure if I want to go back. I left disappointed.

8wQV3XurpYmGkww-Efj-jw.text: Best BBQ location in the Charlotte area, this new location seems vastly improved over the other location. Better parking, better atmosphere and better service

gTTlcz8_kuxKDR8yk_uOww.text: Stopped here during an overnight stay in town on our way to atlanta. After almost a year up in New Jersey we were craving some real southern bbq. The place did the trick. Rib and chicken combo was great especially with the eastern Carolina bbq sauce(mustard based). Sides were ok. My sons brisket was off the charts though. Next time I come here that will definitely be the go item!!

3tEeLTtG1IIA2qwhQ0Wefw.text: Not bad.  If you crave a slightly greasy, chain BBQ taste with a pre-fab interior you may like it.  Me - I would HIGHLY recommend you venture further south to Rock Store in Waxhaw.  You'll be glad you did...

KT1ipEbWAQSUedMU3-g8_w.text: I decided to give this place a try since I love BBQ. Decor was nice, service was nice but the food was below average, I had the chopped BBQ plate which was dry and not much flavor. I am not in any hurry to rush back there.

orantn1Q9HnxblPCr2DsKg.text: I have just eaten one of THE BEST BBQ plates in the 25 years I have lived in this area. Grateful I live in Plaza Midwood but this was at the Ballantyne location. Smokey, flavorful, moist Eastern BBQ. Excellent mac and cheese side. The baked beans were spicy, which I loved. This was a to go order that I was told would be ready in 20 minutes. I got there in 10 and the order was waiting for me. I have also eaten at the P-M location but this was my first BBQ plate. It certainly will not be my last.

q507qnLL-P2KYnFkLGK4sA.text: Just love the food. Great service and great food!  Often take guests to dine here and everyone loves their pulled pork sandwiches and sweet potato fries. Will definitely continue to eat here. Take out is always wonderful too!

xqwEQ1BnwBafXWJPloeKeA.text: This place has some of the best brisket in town.  I started off with the bacon wrapped jalapenos today and the bacon tasted a bit old, which is not normal for what I am used to at Midwood.  I also order the TX Brisket sandwich with the Philly-style Mac and Cheese, which also happened to be the day's special.  The Brisket sandwich was spectacular, but the Mac and cheese was basically a few peppers and a couple pieces of brisket slapped on top of Mac and Cheese... definitely not worth the $5 upgrade to the premium side.  The service was excellent and I will continue to go to Midwood as my 'goto' for BBQ in the Ballantyne area.

iOCkumQo0eClMPBb5LRD-g.text: I've eaten here for lunch twice and even though I wanted to love the place, I can only say that it's okay.  I had the brisket the first time (when they initially opened) and it was dry and hard.  I had the mac and cheese and some other side but they weren't good either.  While I normally find it blasphemous to eat subpar mac and cheese; I figured they were new and needed to adjust so I tried them again. The second time was better.  I had a burger and fries that were good (but they aren't to get right(.  I would eat there again, but they wouldn't be one of my choices as when looking for great food.

7xcxm2P4VgWxYULZEAdoyg.text: I could not finish my meal. SALT my goodness, the salt content was absurd. Collard greens were so salty they were horrible. Ribs, salt, the only thing that I had that wasn't salty was cole slaw and water. Never again

4bwYKsMYycBjclKoe79lJw.text: read and seen many reviews and when a trip to see the brother in law in charlotte, it was a must try.  Bought, all in large plate option, 2x ribs, pulled pork, burnt ends and brisket.  Winner was the brisket by a landslide.  Moist tender flavorful and oh so delicious.  Burnt ends were a mixed bag of dry but flavorful and moist and flavorful.  Ribs were a little dry and tough but still good. then the pull pork, its ok, its pork strips with a vinegar dressing.  We had it as 'take out' so it wasn't all their fault.  The sides were smoked veggies (meh), sweet potato fries (crunchy and good even when cold), cream corn (good), bbq cole slaw (tasted like minces cabbage in watered down pull pork dressing), bbq beans (good and tasty), mac and cheese (good).  I would go here again but would try the famous one on Central Avenue.   i guess next time when we drive 700 miles again to see my bro in law.  by the way Charlotte, NC is beautiful.

dPPLE9kqI9HQFFkt7yWZHw.text: After getting mixed reviews of this restaurant we decided to give it a try. After a 30 minute wait, we were seated and service was prompt and satisfactory. My wife ordered the ribs, I ordered pulled pork. The food arrived promptly, but, unfortunately it was not particularly outstanding. The portions were generous, but my fries were limp and greasy, pulled pork was good. My wife's ribs were dry and not very "meaty". We found out later that if you want the "meaty" ribs you have to pay double! Really? The couple next to us found this out the hard way when they received their bill, which was over $30.00 for a rib dinner. While our dinner was ok, I doubt we will return, there are better choices available. I don't know, maybe it's the building they are in. Sticky Fingers closed because it went downhill in quality, hope Midwood Barbecue has better luck. They will have to improve greatly to ever get me to return.

85pIZyIEj3ZLKbNM9Lj1sA.text: Went for lunch and food was excellent. Service was a B+. Parking was a little tough but not a problem walking off all that food. We will return for dinner.

HjqAN_SMiPPcHdaE2jcoeQ.text: We love the original Midwood location, so we were pumped when this location opened up. We finally made it in for dinner, and I was so pleasantly surprised that the new location was just as great as we were hoping for. My boyfriend always gets a dish called the "Pig Out" where you can select a variety of the barbeque and also get a few sides. I usually trust the creative genius and go with the special. Very rarely, I'll opt out of the special and go with a loaded grilled cheese sandwich. SOOOOO good.  A few tips: 1. If you're going in on a busy shift, try using the app called No Wait. It allows you to get in line without actually being at the restaurant and will wait for you. Our favorite restaurants use it, and it has saved us from the crowded and hungry waiting scenario that everyone dreads. 2. Get the mac and cheese, then dip it in the Carolina style sauce. One of the servers at the Midwood location recommended it to me once, and I've never looked back. The bacon wrapped jalapenos are also delicious. I respect Midwood for leaving the heat in the jalapeno. If you don't like spicy, opt for the creamed corn instead. 3. If you're on a diet, save up for a cheat day. The fatty brisket will make you so happy you did. If you never take a day off, however, you can get your brisket lean.  4. Get over there as fast as you can! It's so so good.

d4jDTHKaz0u4pUNIzFHFqg.text: this was my third time at this location. First visit was within a month of the opening and everything was great, food, service and atmosphere. my second visit was a month later was considerably different. Dined in, poor  service and received the wrong food order twice.not really a major problem because we were in no hurry and the waitress was new. But this third and last visit was today. Take-out order for myself and my brother who had never been there before  that take-out order was incomplete not once but twice.  Thank goodness we checked the order before we left. The manager was very responsive and tried to give us partial credit for our food order. We said no thanks just needed a complete order. The barbecue pork was greasy and very salty this time   macaroni cheese was delicious and the smoked chicken was tender  it is quite apparent that this location has a higher turnover of staffing based on my observation and service   Unfortunately this will be our last visit at this location. The other location is excellent food and wonderful service

ub-Dwggh3AxWYV_rcSCTbQ.text: Came here while I was in town for my cousin's wedding. I was super excited to try BBQ here because that's what this part of the US is known for!   It was time to splurge since I don't come here often.   My group ordered two Pig Out Platters for the four of us.  Pig out comes with 4 proteins, 2 sides, hushpuppies, and pickled onions.   What we got:  Proteins:  - lean beef brisket: skip out on this and indulge in the fatty beef brisket because it's so worth it  - fatty beef brisket: so juicy, tender, and fatty. It literally melted in my mouth. My favorite!  - St. Louis Style pork ribs x2: fell off the bones, and super yummy!  - chopped pork: don't recommend. It was kind of dry and too smoky.  - hickory smoked sausage x2: Just okay, nothing out of this world.  - chopped chicken: Same as the chopped pork.  If I come here again, I would order 2 fatty beef brisket, pork ribs, and hickory smoked sausage. I also got the sauce on the side which was a good move because I don't like my bbq drenched in sauce!    Sides:  - Collard Greens: didn't try  - Smoked Veggies: surprisingly very good. My favorite side! This is a must!  - Classic mac & cheese: wish it was more cheesy  - Crinkle cut fries: wish it was more crunchy!  - hushpuppies: wow, so crunchy on the outside! SO GOOD.  - pickled onions: didn't try this because I dont like pickled stuff  It was quite a lot for us and we went home with leftovers.   Our waitress was really friendly! Great customer service.   Definitely a must when in Charlotte! Even Hillary Clinton & Obama thought so!!!
