Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. pig out platter

lHLoV64-PHVWPDkDC07OfQ.text: We have been looking for a good bar-b-que place off and on for 5yrs. Our server was excellent. He was able to explain the menu, meats and sauces. In fact the entire staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Now, being from Midwest, I'm use to sauce cooked with meat. Since moving to south I realize Bar-B-Q is arced dry with sauce on side. At Midwood they have dry rub, meaning the meat is extremely seasoned and the sauce adds to the flavor. The food portion was enormous and tasted amazing!  Highly recommend this place to everyone!!!

57L-sqiXQTQYnLMyYZw1Ig.text: Great Father's Day Service. Christie is awesome. He truly enjoyed his Father's Day. Full rack of ribs for him with the Sunday special Bloody Mary. Brisket for me (not pictured)...always fatty.

WEs6aynP4WOXyg_Uqn7dBA.text: I've never been to North Carolina, so what do I know :) But Midwood Smokehouse is across the street from my hotel, and has great food, great service, and great prices.  I've never had NC style vinegar BBQ, but it was great! And the waitress was very patient with me, let me have both vinegar and tomato sauce with my Carolina pork.  Two days later, I went back and had the pork "burnt ends" and they were fantastic too.  $12 for a human-sized entre, so well worth it!  Beer needs work, but I know I am from Seattle, so I am spoiled in that regard :) but was still good. Matt and Amanda were very helpful in choosing local IPAs.  People very friendly, service is excellent.

xLJYThQKr1fV_ciIQ4ob0w.text: First time here but what a great experience. The good was great and so much that I have lunch tomorrow. Sat at the bar and the staff was incredible. Highly attentive. A rarity at most bars. The burnt pork tips were fantastic. This will be a regular stop.

MCRE0sVnFOagWjHzMqkoXg.text: Amazing food. Got the brisket it was delicious. The sweet tea was great collard greens and mac & cheese where also amazing definitely a great barbecue spot. Didn't disappoint

c0QysGqOQiiuWQSAYHSsLQ.text: Great and fast service! Not a long wait for Sunday nite, beef brisket and wings are great! Waitress are really sweet! Love the location as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great wings!

1S6RLi32pokJJA1oz2R_Bw.text: Visiting from out of state, a state that is known for it's barbecue, and this place is delicious! We had the decadent pimento cheese fries with brisket, delish! I had the midwood chopped salad with brisket, a salad with lots of good stuff in it-highly recommend. My sons got wings as an appetizer that they raved about, St. Louis ribs they loved, and a grilled cheese with pulled pork sandwich which was amazing. Staff was nice, bar staff was great too.  Would come again if I'm ever back here in the area.

0mzw5C1mTMpBz3frvg_mzw.text: Always go to the same place for BBQ, deciding to change things up and went to Midwood.  Flying solo so sat at the bar.  The service at the bar was excellent-my server was quick to pour me a beer and get me a menu-very friendly and attentive! To compare to my favorite place, I ordered similar items--beef brisket, collard greens and baked beans.  The plate also came with hush puppies. The portion was excellent, and don't leave hungry-good value for the food.  The brisket had a little fat, which made it moist, and good smoke.  They offer the BBQ sauces on the side - a vinegar base and tomato base sauce, I stayed with the tomato based sauce. Overall, the food was good, and the service was excellent! I've had their burnt ends before and thought they were excellent.  Some BBQ joints only offer the burnt ends as an appetizer, this place it's a meal with sides.  I will definitely be back, as the server also told me they do a burnt ends with Pork!

0DV3r1twepPXUHDdnw7MDg.text: My waitress was so sweet and her laugh was adorable.  I felt like she really wanted to make our experience worth while.  Heart eyes for days for Cristie.

lSLxeHTPDQJkAGVw3xy9LQ.text: We LOVE Midwood Smokehouse and have been to 3 locations.  We have visited this location a couple times.  I stand by my 5 star reviews with the main location and this one had the potential to be 5 stars as well, as the food has been top notch each time.  This location just has issues with service.  One time we we missing a side with a large to go order but we didn't realize until we got home.  Didn't do anything about it as it was just a side. Just worth mentioning now since there are issues with this location.  Last Friday we came here to send my brother in law off with his last bbq before he went overseas for awhile.  Midwood was busy and had a wait, no issue, but when we were called in we were a table of 3 put in a booth meant for 6-8 people it looks like.  Made it incredibly hard to have a decent conversation with how wide we were spread out!  We ordered drinks from the bar.  Wrong drink came for me but it was fixed.  This was because the server wasn't paying attention, I even said my drink twice because I don't think he got it, clearly he didn't.   Food came and was prompt.  Was great as always.  Loved the pork and burnt ends!  Always consistent.   But after we got the food, it just seemed like they were trying to get us out as quickly as possible.  Asking if we were done.  Nope not yet.  My husband and I were finally done and had ours boxed up.  Server came back with the box and asked the two of us if we wanted anything else.  No.  Then he tries to take my BIL's plate when he was still eating.  Then he comes back with the bill.  Okay BIL is still eating and just got a new beer.  What is he wants something else?  He eventually finishes his plate and then he starts on his beer.  Waiter tries to take the bill but there is nothing in it, plus my BIL and husband are still working on beers.  One of the hostesses comes by and takes our water cups.  Okay, I guess we are done here then.  We just decide to pay and go on our way since they probably needed that large table for a different group.  Either way, we are still customers and should not be pushed.  Fix your service and you could be 5 stars too!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great food - pork, pork ends, and burnt ends

cNQdal0i6jcw7qdTvgvWDA.text: Maybe it was an off day, but I have seen others say good things about the burnt ends here............. I have to say, I didnt agree with them too much. Mine were kind of dry and lacked flavor. Sucks because I need to find a good burnt end place in the area (I am new here). Now, I will praise the wing appetizer that we ordered. That was the best thing my group ate. The other items were decent (mac & cheese, hush puppies, bacon wrapped jalapeno), but the crispy wings were the move for me.We also tried the ribs (pretty good) and the 1/2 chicken entree (also pretty good).   I will try another spot for my burnt ends craving, but the wings are awesome.

rZbHirFTu31VAZLaPI_ISQ.text: Hey, I posted this on Google too, so hopefully I don't get dinged for that. Anyway, this is for the Johnston Rd. location --  Okay, so first and foremost the service was AMAZING. Our server, Melissa, outshined everything, even the food (which is darn near impossible in this spot.) She was so friendly, she brought us everything we didn't know we were gonna need and made spot on recommendations regarding the menu. Legit, even if the food wasn't great, I'd come back for her.  Luckily, the food is incredible and everything we ordered was unbelievable. Normally I would've driven to the Plaza Midwood location, but we were right around the corner and I am so glad we got a chance to check out this location because otherwise I wouldn't have gotten to meet Melissa!

iXYGmHpW2AvWQk0uV1b80Q.text: Great food and service. Came here on Monday afternoon. The food came out pretty fast and it was pretty tasty. The pickle onions were a great addition to the dishes.

6wAG6NZWzDmnhiD4Tm2ueA.text: I hate being "that table" but some times its just unavoidable. Going to dinner with a large group, majority being kids can be challenging. Add in alcohol and the adults can be equally just as much of pains. Thankfully our kickass server (Dylan) was able to maintain control. Although I do apologize again for our repeated spillings (by the adults).  I came in wanting to try everything. The only meat I didn't include in my order was the burnt ends. It'll have to wait till my next visit. As for everything else, we loved it. Jalapeno's wrapped in bacon were great. Also tried some fries with pork or brisket on them.. The ribs were delicious and fell right off the bone. Pulled pork was exactly how I like. The chicken was my least favorite but even that was good. Sides were what you would normally expect from a place like this.   If you haven't been to Midwood and you live in Charlotte, you are missing out.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fat mans dish, forget what it&#39;s called but as you can see it has it all.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stuffed jalapeños

AsXu7U6mxaoK5rAtplmAYQ.text: Yum! My husband and I shared the pig out platter. Holy cow (pig?) was that a lot of food. We had the pulled pork, ribs, brisket and chicken. Everything was smoked perfectly and juicy. They served the platter with 4 different sauces; each sauce was unique and so good. Even sharing this platter we took home enough food to eat another person or two.

ideHy-S9k5fhjbl5Wt882A.text: Great spot to hit on my way to SC.   The brisket (lean), the beef burnt ends and the creamed corn were all excellent.  The topper was the pecan cobbler - which must be 2000+ calories.  So, either split it 10 ways or just have a bite, it's big enough!   It was pretty empty on the Monday night, but the wait staff was very attentive and welcoming.

6k18T5OZZe2WRtptZXd3BQ.text: I am normally a huge fan of Midwood Smokehouse. When they're good, they are good-absolutely delicious. But when you order a burger well-done and instead get it rare (three or four times), you start to wonder about their commitment to quality. The last time I ordered, the person at Midwood called me "hon" at least five times, said he couldn't "control the kitchen". As if my discrepancy was uncalled for. As if the kitchen staff could not be called upon to cook a burger as requested.

9om3lhTXjERG8IvCI1To3w.text: My family and I dine here pretty often. Great bbq selection. Price is great and the portion sizes are good. I've have never had a bad  experience. The best server is WALTER. He is extremely knowledgeable about each item on the menu, he explains the sauces so well. He is timely and swift. He is to  attentive to every detail. He is managerial material for sure. Make sure you ask for WALTER I mean he was just amazing

8KgpjIp2dbA0fZG4-x8xZw.text: (5/28/17) I felt like bbq tonight so my wife drove us over to Midwood. We got a trainee waitress Ally and her trainer who failed to introduce himself. I ordered bacon wrapped jalapenos. They had good flavor but no heat. The next course is nachos libre with brisket and an old Mecklenburg hornet's nest beer. My wife is getting chicken wings. The trainer, whose name was Trent but we found that out when we got the bill, had promised us BBQ sauce which was never given to us. He also recommended the excellent beer but had promised a glass of water as well that was never brought to the table. My wife asked me why I didn't remind them about the missing items. I told her that it wasn't up to me. The nachos were average at best. There was so little brisket that it was clumped in a thin strip down the center of the dish rather than spread throughout it. That was disappointing.  My wife had ordered the chicken wings on Trent's recommendation because he told her that they had switched suppliers and that the wings were larger than they had been previously. Apparently he didn't remember how small the previous wings were since my wife said that these wings looked like pigeon wings too. They were definitely the smallest wings I'd ever seen.  Well at least I have two less dishes that I will choose the next time that we eat here.

YY4vB8vTl2CfDd-K_W3HnA.text: Love the decor. The service was excellent and all the good was great! Prices were reasonable also. Have gone before and will come back often.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Like the light fixtures

-jEoTwY2a0LMNa7CuuNxrQ.text: This was our first visit to this location. Service is the main issue. I ordered the small chopped salad & a brisket sandwich. My wife had the pork sandwich. The salad came out with my sandwich & had the wrong dressing with it. I sent the salad back because of the timing. My wife liked her sandwich. The waitress asked if she was finished before she was finished. She then presented the check & had to take it back because my wife wanted the banana pudding. She described the BP as cake, banana & whipped cream:(  P.S. What's with the blaring hard rock music...country would be so much more appropriate.

G4rY6iosHrEu3nCjHKh8qw.text: Im not certain which bbq joint people are reviewing here. I took my hubby her for fathers day dinner and we were sorely disappointed in the food. We ordered the chicken taco for my lil boy and didnt realize it was going to be smoked chicken which my the way is basically boiled chicken (not bbq smoked) the consistency was an issue. it was like one big piece of chicken and the worse part was it looked undercooked. So my lil boy wanted nothing to do with it. The ribs were overcooked and dry and salty.  We will def not be going back.

Cyi6k7zLl2Ub4raLdp66gg.text: My first time here and it was outstanding. First of all, no country music which is a huge plus! Rock n roll music that was excellent. Next the food: our server, Iimane, suggested the well-fed combo platter which includes your choice of 4 meats and 2 sides for $24. We chose the burnt ends ($2 extra), the brisket, pulled pork and chicken. For sides, the mac n cheese and the bacon-wrapped jalapeno poppers. So, the burnt ends were delicious chunks of brisket bathed in BBQ sauce and they were tasty. The pork was lightly covered in vinegar sauce, white meat chicken comes plain so you can choose any of their 4-5 sauces. The mac n cheese is homemade and the poppers are hot and spicy, so good.  Service, food, music and atmosphere was all excellent so I highly recommend.

nHAQqcg4g1A4KW7fuvMxJQ.text: Amazing menu with great assortment. Good "southern" sides and pickled   onions are really, really good.  Hubby had brisket and it was spoon tender. I had burnt ends. Fabulous. Small size platters were really not so small. Great assortment of beers and various wines and the hard stuff.  Nice atmosphere, very friendly staff and quick service.  Very relaxed atmosphere with lots of TV.

2HRxr3hGOHkyom4l5GfyOQ.text: We went here expecting greatness. In the end, there was a feeling of disappointment with the food being mediocre. Got the half rack of ribs with hush puppies. Hush puppies were small ball of floured cornmeal. Seemed to have a pretzel-like texture. Not really as soft and grainy as expected. The ribs were far below expectation. I make better ribs on my grill, with better flavor.  Rib tips were extra crispy and burnt.    I wouldn't come back here unless I needed to.  Service was excellent, by the way!    In addition, there was a creepy waitress who kept lingering around, standing way too close to me when taking orders and talking to us, and rushed us even though she said she wasn't.

28cMRpCsxODeLtWn62jfSg.text: We had never been here. Service was great and the food was excellent! Asked the waitress what was popular. She recommended the Abilene brisket sandwich. Not to mention the Classic Bloody Mary was delicious! Great choice! We will go again!

Pfpn8FIvswfAgmRCPs4gow.text: There are few times in life that a meal is so wonderfully crafted and inspired that it leaves you savoring each bite and longing to return.  This meal did neither.   As there really was not anything wonderfully crafted or inspired about the meal.   It did not leave me anticipating my next trip back.   Maybe it was a bad day, but the food was just average at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken with smoked vegetables.  The smoked veggies were the best thing on the plate.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 taco meal.  One of each.   The brisket and pulled BBQ were my favorites.  The chicken was ok but not great.

XgEN0Tp4wQsGxwuXxh0IyA.text: Went to Midwood looking for the elusive eastern Carolina bbq.  Oh...  I found it.  And this was an experience I'll never forget.  This was the best bbq I've had since visiting a po dunk grandma bbq joint in wake forest.  I am in bbq nirvana.  The sauces are amazing. The had sweet,  spicy,  mustard and vinegar.  Just what I was looking for.   I can't wait to come back. Can we get one of these in California.?

vWKeX2esN7PZv9QHoRjnig.text: Excellent food. The food was delicious. The servers could have been a bit more attentive in the beginning. After it was brought to their attention, things got better, including a complimentary appetizer.

Zq1_Z1h5OFnnKUO-qtNvIw.text: Had dinner at Midwood Smokehouse. Was seated promptly.  Jalapeno appetizer was excellent.  Between us, we had the BBQ chicken, ribs and brisket.  Everything was good but the ribs were the besr. Deliciously seasoned so sauce was not necessary.  I also loved the BBQ beans, my favorite side for sure. In my opinion,  they could have put less ice in the drinks.  The wait staff was attentive and friendly.

x7CkEdOzLSszIPMVK-x-pw.text: This is the best barbecue I've ever had, easily, in my entire life. The pulled pork was my favorite ever, and everything else I tried was on point, especially the burnt ends, which you can get any day of the week. I also tried a bbq salad with green goddess dressing, that was wonderful--hard to accomplish at an amazing bbq joint. We actually ordered take out and the service was great. Everything was packaged well (but sadly, they forgot my ranch) and the woman who helped me over the phone was someone I feel I should try to meet in person so we can be friends. As for the prices, I felt they were priced very fair, especially for the quantity and quality of what we received. Great experience at Midwood and I know we will be back again and again.

anGGnfjaI1aFgcYeKQaDpw.text: The best bbq in town. Our server drew was awesome. Carolina pork + mac + bacon wrapped jalapenos!!!!

6FmoQ0_YoEc7-tcxav9tZA.text: The brisket was amazeballs!  So much flavor. And the service was spot on. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Charlotte.

y4aqM7OHMYWN1sGlSKCpCw.text: One of the better bbq joints in the Charlotte area. And there are many. Try the Abiline Brisket sandwich. The whole menus has great stuff. Definitely try a few of the sides.

YriHg1uKfDshAqe9NDhpzA.text: This was my first visit to Norwood Smokehouse, and it will not be my last. Shantel was our server, and she was excellent. I decided to try a few new things: Burnt Ends (of bee brisket), Smoked Vegetables, and their Collard Greens. I can not properly describe how delicious the Burnt Ends are! I really could eat just them for the rest of my life and be eternally happy. The Smoked Vegetables did not disappoint -- yummy!  The Collard Greens were the way I like them as they did not contain too much vinegar; however, for those that enjoy more Shantel did offer me vinegar if I had wanted more. Everyone at the table was really pleased with their meals. Norwood Smokehouse is definitely on my local favorites list. Enjoy!

Sy1LlY-Qixw9HHgU7QyV3w.text: We had heard a lot of great things about this place, and I am sorry to say that it did not live up to expectations.  The portions were small, the taste was okay but nothing exceptional. The service was lackluster at best. Too many other really good places to eat BBQ to make a special trip here again, at least for us.

fw5eXfU4dZznYaBThesCyA.text: Ate there for the first time today. Out of ribs at 4pm but it was Father's Day, so it's understandable. On the waitresses recommendation, I ordered the supposedly one pound beef rib. When it arrived me and my wife both looked at each other saying that's one pound of meat. It was cooked right with good flavor but no where near a pound of beef. I made mention to the waitress and she kind of agreed with me. She said she mentioned it to the manager but nothing was taken off the bill. Oh, the meal price was $28.00 which if it was a full pound of meat would be worth it. My wife could not get ribs, so she ordered a burger which she said was good. I guess I should have ordered the burnt ends which I originally wanted. Not saying I will not return but you would think that first time customers with an issue would be comped in some way.....anyway, my dog is happy, he's currently chewing on the rib bone which probably made up close to 1/2 of the one pound weight.....

iqfZfWgpYdL1G78vfUR6mQ.text: A really good experience.   Great service and really good food.  Server offered  and brought a sample of brisket to the table.   We are in town for a week and after the meal we were trying to figure out when we could come back.   Nice draft selection with good smoked meats equals winner.

pg09e5fd981lvfCBXviDKg.text: Love Midwood Smokehouse on Central, this place is not like the Central Ave location. Food good, service good, just not the same feel. Almost felt like a chain restaurant like the Sticky Fingers before it. Would have been four stars if I felt at home, just didn't.

qukxfpTWmrReJLdae-ewzg.text: My husband and I had been anxiously awaiting the opening of Midwood Smokehouse in Ballantyne.  We went opening weekend and loved it!  Attentive service, friendly staff, hot and fresh food - overall a great experience.  We have been talking about going back and we're looking forward to making it a regular dining out spot.    Fast forward to today - 4th of July.  From the moment outer server came to the table, it was obvious she didn't want to be there.  Same went for management, food runners, etc.  By the time the meal came my husband and I felt like we didn't want to be there either.  Then the food... It was gross.  So apprentice the cooks didn't want to be there either.  We got a plate with 4 meats... The brisket was dry and lukewarm.  The pulled pork was also dry and cold.  The ribs were the only thing that came out hot besides the macaroni and cheese.  Our server didn't come to check on us, we flagged down a food runner to ask for some hot fries, the second set of fries also came back cold!    It's unfortunate that no one wanted to work today.  It has potential, as we loved our first visit.  But went downhill quickly.  Maybe a hot or miss depending on the day.

HQVbOmTLHsFihelwXRfBFg.text: Let me start by saying that our waiter was great. He was very attentive and accommodating. The food however was another story. I had the beef tips which were actually ok. That's where it ended. The mac and cheese was absolutely gross, the ribs and chicken were not good at all. My husband and I even ordered drinks and those left something to be desired. I was told afterwards that we should've gone to the original smokehouse in plaza midwood.

73VqiRqmt16-2VrZ5MqxEA.text: Wow...this place is amazing. It was so good in fact that my wife suggested that we change our travel plans and stay another night in Charlotte just to eat here tomorrow for lunch. Undoubtedly the best pork ribs I've ever had and hands-down the best baked beans  on the planet.

OCsEN7hpM_FccOxFt6SOOw.text: This is my first time to the area and this restaurant was my first meal here. The server was very very friendly and gave us tons of recommendations (to be honest it was almost not helpful because there were too many). I had a beef brisket sandwich and Mac n cheese on the side. My colleague had brisket with bacon wrapped jalapenos. Everything was delicious!

fvHi3hC6i-FI0TSsgVayaw.text: Wow.  Amazing BBQ place. Went for first time yesterday.  The burnt ends were the best. Bloody Mary's were watery IMO.  Brisket and coleslaw was great.  Not a huge fan of the collards.  Great place and we will be back soon!

UIppbFo0Ys84Ed-jxeSdsg.text: Love those bacon wrapped jalapenos. Careful, there are some really hot ones in there! Thanks to our waiter for running out a glass of milk to me.  Burnt ends sound good in theory but I wish I would have stuck with the STL ribs. Mac & cheese was standard. There was mac. There was cheese.  Banana cream dessert was spot on.  Looking forward to going back again!

6VUUABDj7JxLRxoizPxwfg.text: I've visited this chain at several of the locations and all are good for lunch or dinner. They menu has plenty of items for people that don't want to eat BBQ. Side are generous and all the food is fresh. I especially like the pickled onions that come with the pork plate.

COKs-zV0COGg7Vwi7xbExA.text: I was very surprised today when I stumbled upon this place.  My mother and I ordered his 2 sandwiches I had the Carolina styled and my mother ordered the brisket with cheese and she enjoyed it as well. The service however wasn't the best it was slow however the food was the selling point. I will go back soon

4oIAIFSUAjTKK1zZmB6jsQ.text: I ordered the "Well Fed" combo plate with brisket, sausage, pulled pork, and burn ends. (Which they substituted since they were out of ribs). I really enjoyed it.  The sides of Mac and cheese and beans were tasty as well.  The service was excellent. Plenty of TV playing a variety of programs. I thought the music was a bit loud, but that wasn't a big deal.  I plan on making a trip back before I head home to Texas.

Tqtbc_dBx5Dl3qeQaSfiJg.text: I went around 1:30 near the end of the Lunch Rush. I was greeted with a smile and immediately seated. I admit I was a bit rude as I was on my cell phone. However, the waitress handled it nicely and checked on me until I was ready. She made recommendations & answered any questions that I had. I ordered the Small plate of Chicken BBQ with Mac & Cheese. It came with Hush Puppies & Pickled Onions. I also ordered a side of Texas Toast. The chicken was really good. It was Tender & Flavorful without too much sauce. The Mac & Cheese was also surprisingly good for a restaurant. It was creamy and the top was layered with real cheese and they used seasoning/salt lol. A lot of restaurant Mac & Cheese is bland so I appreciate that. Hush Puppies were good, your average hush puppy. I also enjoyed the pickled onions. I can't really explain them but they were good. I ended up mixing them into my chicken. The Texas Toast was OK. I ordered it thinking I would need something to put my chicken on but I could have went without. It was buttered and toasted to a crisp (Not hard). I prefer my Texas toast to be a bit more soft. But it still wasn't bad. Decor wise it was ok. I'm not one to really notice the decor unless something about it bothers me. The only complaint I have is the booths are high with no foot rest. I felt like all the blood in my legs was rushing to my feet and got uncomfortable so I boxed most of my food to eat later. They do have a few tables but not many. I will be giving this place another try. I'd like to try the ribs, they looked delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken BBQ with Mac &amp; Cheese, Hush Puppies &amp; Pickled Onions
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side of Texas Toast

y2jCceJuDEppkvVwI6A88w.text: I love this place, I can't get brisket anywhere else and be happy.  The wings are amazing as well, and the cheese fries --- oh lawd!  Love Love Love

MuL_Jd9F0FogL03DMdHUlA.text: Took my crew to Midwood Smokehouse last night...1st time there. Food was great...had the St Louis Ribs, they were done to perfection with just right amount of smoke taste. When I first ordered them I was told they were out...I asked for the manager...my server came back and was able to fill out 2 rack order.  She handled the issue just right and was attentive through the whole meal.  My wife had the Brisket tacos and Loved them...shared a bit with me and It may be a real toss-up on what to order next time.  The side were good particularly the baked bean...has some spice to them and they were yummy.  Had a few Ice cold Triple-Cs which went perfect with the food.  Ambiance is nice and casual.  Job well done! We'll be back.

bLl8ruoXEqWd1cki_38DkQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse has excellent, 5 star fatty brisket and mostly good other items.   My family of 6 (5 adults + 1 kid) split a Pig Out combo platter, 2 tacos, and a few sides.   Pig Out Platter with...  - Brisket (fatty): Amazing! So flavorful, moist without being gross like I've had at other places. Probably the best I've had.  - St Louis Style Pork Ribs (dry): A lot of nice smoke flavor in the ribs. I liked them even better when I added sauce which is an option but my dad prefers dry.  - Carolina Chopped Pork: The weakest item in the platter. Texture was good, but the taste wasn't there.   - Hickory Smoked Sausage: Good, nice flavor and texture. The brisket and ribs were good enough that I wish we had just gotten 2x brisket and 2x ribs though!   Stockyard Tacos - Why order tacos at a BBQ place? I think the answer is, "Don't let kids order anything." Somehow the addition of all the taco toppings made the brisket less interesting, not more.   Sides - Hush Puppies: I really liked these hush puppies. Nice crunch on the outside, soft inside, and buttery corn flavor. The only downer was how few we got. The platter came with hush puppies, and we also ordered a side of them, but we still only got about 9.  - Mac & Cheese: Not great. Dry without any strong cheese taste.  - BBQ Baked Beans: Really good! Hearty and meaty.  - Creamed Corn: I've never had this before so I can't really compare it to any other versions, but I liked it. Very rich.  - Collard Greens: They were collards... not much else to say. As good as others I've had.  - Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos: They tasted mostly of bacon. No taste of the peppers themselves or the cheese that was inside.  - Sweet potato fries: A very generous amount of fries. I love sweet potato fries and this was no exception.   The only other weak point to mention is that for a BBQ place, they're surprisingly stingy with the sauce. My whole family had to split 4 small containers of sauce (like takeout ketchup sized). It was busy so it was hard to get more. Even after asking mid-meal, we didn't get any more until our server came by to pack up our leftovers. I've mostly been to places where the containers are just on the table. If you like sauces, ask for more at the start.   Overall: delicious brisket, generous portions, and friendly service with a few minor issues. I'll definitely be back again the next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pig Out Platter and extra sides.

0x_X3OkGfQaRDU3B1ROA3A.text: We were super excited to see the Midwood Smokehouse sign go up so close to where we leave, almost immediately after visiting the Central location. We really liked the food, but didn't like the layout of the Central location.   A few weeks after opening (and getting their liquor license) we stopped by on a Thursday afternoon to get dinner. The dining room had a wait so we sat at the bar. The bar staff works so hard to make all of the drinks and deliver food to the bar guests. We ordered the sampler platter which is 4 meats and 2 sides + hush puppies and pickled onions. In our experience we find that it is best to get the following: pulled pork, pulled pork (x2), ribs, and brisket (combo lean and fatty) along with another order of hush puppies, and macaroni and cheese. We would get another rib vs. another pulled pork however, it costs extra and we are cost efficient.   The ribs are so good, fall off the bone, doesn't need sauce kind of good. The brisket is so good, my husband, (who said he doesn't like brisked) ate his fair share. We got 2 orders of hush puppies because they are worth it. And the mac and cheese, which I am the queen of picky, was gone. Like poof, where did the macaroni go? Kind of gone.   This is also the perfect share with another meal. And they have OMB Copper. And they have BYOM (bring your own mug) night.   Go there. But don't take our seat at the bar.

VzlINZtNTED7GkWGBiXg1w.text: Went there last night at the Ballantyne location for the first time--with out of town guest.  First the water tasted very funny--the waitress told us a number of other tables complained as well.  It is very unusual that a restaurant has bad tasting water!!  They had to bring the water to our table three times--not a good start!  We order the beef brisket and the tacos off the money.  All entrees were unmemorable.  Something we would not go back for.  At the end we all said we should have gone to the Hickory Tavern instead.  Place is crowded now, but I'm sure the crowds will drop off once the 'newness" wears off.

sWNFRLMebK3lmN2TDl2wrQ.text: Ok. Sorry, need to update my review.  We went to Midwood Smokehouse last weekend.  Got the ribs again.  They weren't nearly as good as the first time.  Not sure what happened.  The salad was very good though and so were the greens.  But, a little disappointed with the ribs this time :-(.  Probably the best ribs that I've ever tasted.  Soooo good.  Also had the make your own salad which was awesome.  My daughter ordered collard greens which she said were better than mine and she loves my greens.  I told her that she ought to be glad that she was sitting so far away from me.  But, I have to say that they were good.  Not vinegary like some places.  Personally, I don't like vinegar in my greens.  Can't wait to go back.

_A3xnHaUcOiLv6PuvDnZEQ.text: Everyone is saying it- and I agree- great BBQ! Whether it's sandwiches (their Cuban is bomb!) or a plate of meat; the selection, sauces and sides are delicious. You really can't make a bad choice. They are almost always busy but that doesn't seem to impact service or speed, so that's a big positive. We always bring guests here from out of town and while the ambiance of the one in Plaza Midwood is better, the burbs still love having their new location so close.   So why four stars instead of five? Seems silly, but they literally REFUSED to let me order from the kids menu. I'm not a big eater and was leaving town where leftovers would have been wasted, and the waitress told me no, it's against their policy. She "asked" the manager who also said no, something about the portions being the same size. I was with my husband and father in law, and if you serve children the size of portions they got, those are kids who probably don't order from the kids menu anyway.

XGM8KbDhp-mm5nkSES58Xg.text: I was here recently and not in the mood for meat, so I ordered several of their side items. You can order 4 sides for the cost of $9.  Order was as follows:  Sweet potato fries-cut approximately the size of shoestrings. Lightly salted and a nice mixture of crispy and softly cooked pieces. (I prefer the softly cooked.) There were several in my party, and everyone who sampled them enjoyed them.  Baked beans-flavorful with the tangy sweetness of bbq sauce, and small amounts of meat added in. Not sure what type of meat it was, but it was very tender.   Sweet creamed corn-corn had a nice smoky, peppery flavor, but the cream sauce seemed a little greasy, and the corn was undercooked.  Mac and Cheese-No flavor, just pasta with some cheddar cheese added in. Also had several overcooked bites.  Texas toast-Cost $1.00 extra, and they serve you 4 pieces. It was overcooked, almost to the point of being burnt.  I also received hush puppies with my order, and they were soft, chewy, with a little bit of sweetness, and very good.  Banana pudding-very good, and they serve you a fair amount. I would definitely return just for this!

xqgSsIHXHWzRT_4c4Yg6Cw.text: Service was spot on.  Came w/another couple & everything was scrumptious!  Fried pickles, hush puppies, mac & cheese, bbq platters w ribs - yummy :)

oC_VUumJ9c17gMj5Fe-w8A.text: The food used to be great when they first opened their Ballantyne location. I thought I would not miss Sticky Fingers.  But now?? OMG! I ordered their $24 combo platter (because that is the most cost effective way to have two types of meats, they make you order FOUR and spend $24!). I only ate less than half of the food. It wasn't great tasting. THEN an hour later - let's just say I got SICK and spent the next hour in the bathroom. I'll NEVER be back!!!

Tjfw_5XKyxGoPJny7EYiig.text: What an amazing experience!  Started out with a salad.  Seriously one of the best salads I have ever had.  It was fresh and they added avocado, black beans, and corn.  Then for entree I had the burnt ends with sweet potato fries.  Both were amazing.  The burnt ends were cooked perfectly and the flavor was amazing.  The sweet potatoes were great too.  Then tried the banana pudding.  It was homemade and perfection.  Lastly Donnie was one the most amazing servers ever.  We may go back tomorrow!  I highly recommend this place!

f-6ST91zBHTk8PP1_Ibi9Q.text: Excellent BBQ...there's no other way to put it. The ribs were tender and didn't really even need sauce but I still had to try the house sauce and honey habanero. The latter hit you with a little sweet and then just enough heat to get a little sweat on your brow. The burnt ends that accompanied were caramelized in a Cheerwine sauce and were melt in your mouth tender. For my side I chose bacon wrapped jalapenos because why not. Another winner in my book. My wife had the Carolina pork plate with vinegar slaw and thoroughly enjoyed it. All meals come with hush puppies so honestly you only need the small plate which allows one side. The protein portions were large, everyone brought leftovers back to the hotel. We ended dinner on a sweet note with a small banana pudding and it was pretty solid. Not the best we've had, but it was pretty darn good. Service was excellent, drinks were never empty and our server checked back frequently to make sure we were taken care of. Everyone in our party was happy we chose Midwood and next time we are in town and wanting some BBQ, we will definitely stop back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wednesday special...Ribs and burnt ends with bacon wrapped jalapeños.

vI10E6zchdS6eDSMaHB9Fw.text: Very sad excuse for bar b que. It will probably taste ok if you have four or five beers before eating.

lDmiPGI6OuA7Y75AsUJ5Ag.text: My husband and I flown in from Texas to visit Elevation church (which is absolutely amazing place, you should visit for sure if you're ever in the area) you North Carolina's know what good food is!  We had tea, brisket, ribs, cole slaw, beans, jalapeno wraps, hush puppies and pecan cobbler.  Wow!  Wow! Wow! Love this place!  Matt was an outstanding server! Thank you Midland Bar B Q for a great experience and an awesome server.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

znebiOiFwQNc74hHh-SgvA.text: Great BBQ and experience.  Absolutely delicious brisket and chopped (pulled) pork. Several outstanding sauces to choose from.  Fantastic service by Walter - and Robert (the manager) was especially friendly and informative regarding their smoking process.  Will definitely come back!

lYetKIa6i_4BKIPHwxMCgA.text: I had the salmon entree and a side of the burnt end! The salmon looked like it was probably frozen out of a box and the burn tips were very fatty. Not a great experience. Server did not seem to care about the customers.

Gr1CP23N26Xx7HMF4TQLcg.text: One word: YUM.  Midwood Smokehouse has an atmosphere you'd expect from a smokehouse/steakhouse. It's casual, it's comfortable, it's pretty simple. There's a great bar, a large dining area, and every server we've ever had has been knowledgeable, helpful, attentive, and just the right amount of fun/playful.  Food, served on cute home-y dishes, is incredible. I alternate between the brisket and shredded BBQ. My husband will order nothing except for burnt ends because they're "the best meat candy you could ever have." The sides are just as delicious. Bacon-wrapped jalapenos (a signature Midwood dish), mac-and-cheese, fries, and hushpuppies are a few of our favorites. The banana pudding is KILLER as well. I've truly never been disappointed with anything I've ever had at Midwood. The meal can get a little pricy for BBQ, mostly because we tend to not be able to decide and order a lotta food. But, it's totally worth it! Midwood is one of our Charlotte favorites!

AMi4KA1K-gHypUBxvAkrCQ.text: I feel bad having to give Midwood a 1 Star, but they definitely earned it for my dinner on Friday. They're doing a baby back ribs special and it was horrendous. The meat smelled foul and was gray (over cooked?)... it tasted like it may have been microwaved at one point, but I'm not sure. I have no idea what would explain the smell and taste of the meat, but I just know it was gross. I tried two ribs (I hoped the first was a fluke, but it wasn't) and ate the side of cornbread.   Service was great, but hard to make up for the gross meat. Our waitress asked if we wanted to box it up, and was probably confused as to why the plate was relatively full.   I will say that my wife did enjoy her dinner, but was likewise grossed out by mine.  It'll be a while until we go back... at least until this special is over.

c8WMt47r9XK-sV-my9RTKQ.text: Today we stopped in to the Midwood Smokehouse in Ballantyne on the suggestion of one of our group members (my daughter) who had been previously.  A couple of us were newbies and a bit hesitant because none of our group are pork eaters.  The manager had explained to my daughter that they have very strict rules in the preparation of the food keeping all meats separate with no cross contamination.  The manager was very clear in explaining which side dishes and veggies contained pork and which did not.  The facility was large, very uniquely decorated and well lit.  They had TVs playing so we could watch the March Madness Games if we wanted but they also had music playing at a pleasant level.   We decided order and our server Matt made that very easy.  He had such an easy going, laid back demeanor that we could have stayed all day.  We ordered some beer, wings and all tried the brisket in one way or another.  The food was simply "off the chain" and Matt's service was superior.  Everything came out HOT and straight off the grill.  The flavors were amazing and the meat was so tender.  If you are on a budget consider an entree and an appetizer to share.  Portion sizes are good.  The bathrooms were clean, smelled fresh and were well stocked.  I will definitely go again and will look forward to trying additional things from the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken wing appetizer with BBQ sauce
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket with burnt ends, hush puppies and Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket Tacos with Mac &#39;n cheese

AtoK1vTF8Oz36QIwRu6PYg.text: Had an (unusual) craving for BBQ and decided to try Midwood Smokehouse. Parking lot was full at 12:30, as were the bar and restaurant. Did a ToGo order of a half rack of ribs w.crispy fries as my side. Got in my car, opened the fries to have a few, but they were so good I ate a little more than a few! Tawny golden, thinner then usual crinkle cuts which actually came as a full side, in it's own separate container (yay!). The hefty Texas style ribs were smokey, very moist, topped with a smear of a tomato-based, sweet & savory sauce and fell-off-the bone! Look at how much meat was on them! I only ate 2! Hush puppies, a side of BBQ sauce and slivers of sweet onion also come with the meal. This is the best BBQ I have ever eaten! This gem is somewhat hidden so I forget it's there, but not anymore! I'll go back to try other food, bc the dishes coming out of the kitchen looked scrumptious! Even better, the staff was courteous, friendly and very well trained. $15 well spent!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meaty!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best of!  ....

7aLLdMOTNAWJdqTjhBc_Hg.text: Oh My!  Need to feed your face, then Midwood is the place!  We had a large work group of 25, and Midwood was very accommodating!  Our wait staff team managed the group with ease!  I'm a sucker for char, so I had to try their Pork Burnt Ends which are caramelized cubed pork tossed in our house made Cheerwine BBQ Sauce...Umm, Umm, Umm!  The small plate was the perfect no-leftovers size. You can add more kick with their habanero infused sauce too!  It was just right!    Their homemade coleslaw was a side match made in heaven!  Their homemade hush puppies are little bites of heaven too!  I know where I'm eating the next time I'm in the area!

0d5CgcvN9WlIEOCtXwYB6A.text: Visited for lunch with a friend. Never been to this location. NOT disappointed. Just a great place and experience. Had a house salad first - lots of veggies and variety for a house salad. Then I got the special for an entree: Hawaiian burger (burger with BBQ and pineapple-infused salsa). HOLY HELL - it was so good. A bit messy but my goodness it was filling and delicious. I can't wait to back. Never a bad meal and service is tops.

Lc3grk99KiLMeE6VBacoPg.text: I've been here a total of 4 times and love this place!  Service is amazing, the food is delicious.  I have had the mac and cheese, pecan pie, brisket, burnt ends, ribs, smoked veggies and banana pudding.   There is a temporary appetizer called "Tachos" which is tater tot nachos which I'm hoping becomes an official add to the menu given how good they were.   Tried a buffalo trace old fashioned and it was phenomenal.  The options for kids are great.   We had a slight wait during the last visit but the hostess provided etch a sketches to keep the kids distracted.   Loved not having to listen to hunger complaints and was given an opportunity to browse the menu before getting a table.   Will be back!!

t805bSNBy2mxGvV-8subbA.text: Ordered the lean brisket and half of it was pure fat. But what was even more disappointing is that I went to watch a game while we ate and after asking 5 different people (including the manager) to turn ONE tv to my channel, no one ever did. Needless to say, i will not be back

OI648MygH2YOnAPrezehtg.text: Great food hurt by less than stellar service.  It has been several months since our last visit to Midwood Smokehouse.  The food was as great as ever.  My lean brisket had a great smoke ring and the right amount of juice.  My bacon wrapped jalapenos were just amazing as I remember and a highlight for me.  The pickled onions were also very tasty.  My wife's salmon was cooked perfectly.  The kids' meals were very good as well.    The only downside was not particularly attentive service.  The best example was when she refilled my iced tea, she brought room temperature tea which melted all of the ice in my class.  This left me with a like warm overfilled glass...  Yes, overfilled in that she spilled it on the floor and table when refilling.  I am not a fan of hovering wait staff, but this was to the other extreme.  It was not particularly busy so maybe this was just a bad night.    In all, we are reminded of how much we love the food at Midwood and look forward to more visits soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large lean brisket with bacon wrapped jalepenos, fries, and hush puppies.  Enough to have leftovers.

erX0OqGAgEcYr-aXt09r_Q.text: I'm not sure what happened to Midwood and I say this with the most disappointing feeling because I love their food, I think it's the best in the area for BBQ. Last night was a terrible experience with the service, we waited about 25 to 30 min for a table which I understand it was a Sat night around 7ish. Once our table was available we sat and waited for a good 15 - 20 min completely ignored until a woman I believe was a manager noticed and offered to take our drink order explaining that our waitress was just taking another table's order and would be with us soon. We watched this woman go back and forth from two tables next to us and the register to put orders and not once approached our table to explain or just let us know that we would be next or anything at all! My son is in the hospitality industry and he was fuming... I was trying to be patient because I love this place, I have to agree this was completely rude and left a really bad feeling. 25 minutes later no drinks except for water, we decided to walk out and went to Firebirds, were we felt more appreciated.

jKO7_z2VmB65qbKt54aN2A.text: In town for work and stopped in here. First time having Carolina BBQ and it was really good. I had the Carolina Pork and a co-worker had the Burnt Ends. It was all good and the service was quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina Pork w/ Collard Greens and Coleslaw

_Cz_Nshs5flKJ3toRziPag.text: First time visiting this location. Awesome experience with our server Kelly! She's an amazing young lady! Great food and company.

0zup4wbd1MyKP4Fn2cHAQA.text: Overall we had a really positive experience here.  The food was pretty good, the prices were reasonable, and the service was outstanding.  My wife and I shared a full rack of ribs ($25) and a "Hot Mess" burger ($10).  Both were delicious.  Service really was the high point though.  My toddler was provided a high chair, a children's coloring menu, and crayons.  At the end of the meal, our friendly server even caught that I had left our child's food scissors on my plate.  (I'm sure that losing those would have been a headache down the road.)  I'd go again!  Food:  3.5 stars Value:  4 stars Service:  5 stars Overall:  4 stars

P__mVxDsuCz89mDKu5x0dw.text: Horrible experience.  Mother's Day and reservations. Upon arrival greeted with "we are out of Pork, ribs, burnt ends" we have sandwiches and jalapeno corn bread.  Highly disappointed ...

xqHyQBlVqPnuOGOwY1bixw.text: I know many that LOVE this restaurant - but I just don't get it. I've been twice for lunch and was way underwhelmed. I love good BBQ and have had plenty of it, this restaurant does not come anywhere near the great BBQ I have had. The pulled pork sandwich, a 6 out of 10 at best. Very dry, though they do have a nice selection of BBQ sauces that you can add. The mac and cheese, rather bland - though I did appreciate it not being dry as some mac and cheese can be. The hush puppies were hush puppies, nothing spectacular.

yzjkOyf0HAqxeR5NcTtd1A.text: Yum, yum, YUMMMMMM!!! Favorite BBQ place in Charlotte. Our waiter was awesome too. Super nice and enthusiastic about the restaurant.

_9_2-vA486bu8VRVRVQrcg.text: Having been to the Plaza Midwood location numerous times we are excited they opened closer to where we live. I am surprised by some of the reviews bc we came with a big group and had an excellent meal. The BBQ was just as good as any of our previous meals at the central location. The ribs we had were insanely good along with the burnt ends, pulled pork and brisket. Midwood did not disappoint.

nCEfwvLsoVa4_OEvzhtJAQ.text: We had our rehearsal dinner at Midwood a few weeks ago and it turned out absolutely fabulously. Midwood is one of our favorite spots and we both knew we wanted to have our rehearsal here b/c the food is so Carolina and southern to us. I want to be clear that the success of this dinner is a testament to the staff at Midwood Ballantyne rather than the Midwood private events coordinator. I hate leaving negative reviews for 1 person but I felt Mark, in comparison to all of our other wedding vendors we worked with, was an office oriented person and regurgitated our contract when asked about things. It seemed like he was quick to say no or put restrictions on simple requests. An example of this is when asked if his staff could hang up 1 small banner and light a few LED votives in paper lanterns, he said no and told us we could get there 30 minutes before our scheduled dinner to set up decor but added that he couldn't guarantee our room would even be available 30 minutes prior. As a rehearsal dinner, of course we were going to be rehearsing right beforehand. Fortunately, I stopped by a few hours before our dinner on a whim (was getting manicure at Apple Nails across the street) and the staff on site was SO HELPFUL and didn't hesitate to say "yes, we can easily take 5 minutes to hang a banner & turn on 10 LED votives!". Anyway, with that rant out of the way, I want to make sure that I give credit to not only the awesome wait staff (wish I remembered their names!) but also the kitchen team b/c the food was wonderful. As always! We had about 30 people, so we chose to do 2 meat buffet with several sides, wings as appetizers, banana pudding dessert and beer and wine. Now on their private events menu they don't offer fries as a side and they actually forgot them initially but when I mentioned that we were supposed to have fries, they served a bunch of baskets of fries on all our tables! Which turned out great and I think people enjoyed having them to snack on (especially since french fries don't really translate well to heating dishes, right?). We stayed late and almost closed the place down, they were so nice and even brought out takeout boxes so that our guests could take leftovers! I would probably hesitate to book another Private Event with them b/c I like a more receptive Events Manager.  I have booked private events at The Capital Grill and Dressler's (both locations) and their Events Team were more customer service oriented, flexible and understanding with small requests. They are willing to go around their "rules" to make your event a success... and while the staff at Midwood Ballantyne were awesome, I shouldn't have to show up in person and request things on site and hope they are willing to do it for me, it's not fair to me or the team working that night. Love Midwood as always and I think it's the best BBQ in Charlotte so I will definitely be back :)

cqIftiE51BwUhVUFj68LPQ.text: This is is best CAROLINA pulled pork barbq in Charlotte! Their baked beans have barbq in them. Sooo good! Great location.

Ug45nHob7pAb25m66IC7xA.text: Finally got to try it a couple of weeks ago.  They had a special, with burnt ends brisket and rib combo, with cheer wine sauce.  Wasn't a fan of that sauce, but my wife had the standard midwood sauce, and I was able to dip the burnt ends in that and it was a lot better.  The macaroni and cheese was the highlight.  That was really enjoyable.  The beer was ice cold and the server was friendly.  Food came out quick.  I like to eat, but I'll tell you, they give a lot of food in the large portion.  Couldn't finish it.  I'll go back again.  Either way it's worth a visit.

c98zrBEJUqHyXcIxNfOWlA.text: Stopped for lunch on a weekday. Busy, but there was still ample seating available. Asked the server for her recommendations and was suggested to try the burnt ends or the beef brisket. Husband and I tried 1 of each. We got the large serving and it left us stuffed. Sides of collard greens, Mac and cheese, hush puppies were all delicious with flavors that held their own along side the smoked meats. Last note on the service. Not only was our server on top of keeping our drinks filled but every server and manager who passed us were scanning the tables to take away plates or fill up drinks. Team work has the place running smoothly during an otherwise busy lunch hour.

aCwvV0Yqz09YA6efY6jPFw.text: The BBQ was phenomenal! The only downside was that my husband and one of the other friends we were with got sick from the cole slaw. I feel pretty confident that it was just a bad batch.

K4O3L3sEWIr3py9Srjwlbw.text: I've been to this particular location twice since its opening last Spring. I've also frequented their original location and I can tell you that this place is excellent! The service was exemplary & the food is second to none. I've enjoyed the BBQ chicken & ribs. My husband has had the tacos & brisket. The ribs were tender but not cooked to "mush". And the sauce was sweet but not overly so.  Try the banana pudding! You won't regret it!!! I love this place!

XCWAr3WHcTaokG79CmuL2A.text: Hands down, most kind, considerate, and genuinely compassionate restaurant experience I have had in a while. Being an Activities Director at a local skilled nursing facility, I employ a great amount of patience and excellence to make my residents' days happy and fulfilling. When I took 10 of them out to Midwood Smokehouse for lunch today, I was greeted with exceptional, highlight on EXCEPTIONAL service. From the servers to hostesses, each of my residents were treated with respect, consideration, and kindness. When employees go out of their way to show others the level of respect that the employees did at this restaurant today, it not only makes the dining experience memorable, but it shows that good people are in every corner of the world and are ready and able to serve others. Thank you to the staff of the Ballantyne Midwood Smokehouse for making our experience phenomenal and for showing our residents the respect they so rightfully deserve!

HUo2WRwDgSlpyol6mDt5PA.text: Midwood Smokehouse is the best BBQ I have ever had.  Where are these other bad reviews coming from----maybe jealousy....I've had BBQ all over NC, Memphis and Texas and this one beats them all.  The brisket is amazing and i often dream about the beans and Mac and cheese!  I recently ordered the pimento cheese fries with pulled pork and they are the perfect comfort food.

3POutYwntuDM8uNxfHZ8IA.text: I prefer the plaza mid wood location. This location doesn't seem as warm. The food seems a little different as well. Just a lil.

mnuaCEn_g5etmwpvI7oI3w.text: I have been to Midwood Smokehouse a couple times but I felt my last experience deserved to be reviewed.  To start, the food as always was delicious.  I usually go for the ribs but our server had suggested the burnt ends and they were phenomenal.  Will definitely be ordering them again in the future.  The banana pudding is the best I've ever had.  My only complaint is the music- needs a lot of improvement. They had also ran out of a beer that I wanted but our server, Jennifer, gave me similar options and I ended up picking one I liked even better than my first choice.  She was very friendly and knowledgeable- excellent service and good at her job.  I also appreciate the manager checking in on us to see how we were doing.  Great food and service, just work on the music (type and volume).

t68a7IjH4QGioJ7tQEqpjw.text: Ok, I'm going to admit that I dont know this kind of BBQ, so I have a hard time reviewing it because I'm use to barbequing on a grill. All that smoked and saucy shit sucks. I love the True flavor of grilled meat, without all the sauce and seasonings. My bro in law makes the best ribs, so juicy and succulent and real, no smoky flavor. With that being said, we ordered the Smoked Jalapeno popper wrapped in bacon. They were inedible, thats how hot they were. Yeah, yeah, yeah. I know jalapenos are hot and I love heat, but these were horrificly hot and the smoke "flavoring" was so overbearing, I had to send them back. They were very understanding about that. We split the combo of ribs with coleslaw and hushpuppies. The ribs were tender and meaty and tasted good, but Not succulent and juicy and unctuous like my bro in law's. The coleslaw was a little dry, need some mayo. The hushpuppies were delicious!! They were really small tho. They were not hot, but they were crispy and oh so flavorful. We ordered dessert. I ordered Keylime pie and he ordered Banana pudding. He loved it, I didnt taste it. Mine was ok, but too cold and hard. I'll try again and the looks of the pics posted here, I'm going with the Brisket. You southerners might love this place, but its just not what I'm used to.

gDOCJ4kXR-kC64s2XU3kYw.text: Love the BBQ. Friendly wait staff and the bartenders are not stingy with the liquor. Great place for lunch. Fast service and great food

OwBl7L0QG7OCN9A7origqg.text: Another reviewer claimed this is not AUTHENTIC NC BBQ, he's right. Real hickory smoked pork BBQ is almost impossible to find, both in NC and SC! I've made trips to nationally rated BBQ joints in both states, Sweatman's, Scott's, BBQ King and Lexington, among others. None are close to Midwood to me. If you don't like smoked meats then this is not the place for you. But if you do, you won't find any better. Moist and tasty, don't ruin this by putting sauce on it. Kudos to Hayley, an excellent waitress on two occasions I have been. To management, make a trip to Pit BBQ in Griffin Ga for some outstanding Brunswick Stew. You would make a killing as a side here in Charlotte. And gluten free, please.

4-zlo2WsXoF85Djf_eyk7A.text: I went there with my husband and son, after my husband was at the original Midwood Smokehouse in Plaza Midwood and thought it was great.  To be honest the meal was OK nothing over the moon.  My husband told me I have to try their other location.

3lFQYzmghoQQZQN3sl1Oyg.text: The food is delicious and plentiful well thought out seating for large groups or small. Music is a little loud (and country) wait staff is hit or miss especially around 9pm (restaurant is open till 11pm) The several times we have been staff sometimes gets caught up doing side work and forgets to check back timely. The food makes up for it.

Db1thcpUcL-RZ7jYfkwq5w.text: I usually go to the uptown location. This location is closer to home so we decided to try it. Don't like it. Uptown is more of a bar with less children. This location is a family restaurant. Totally different. I'll be driving uptown from now on.

M_uHycuV_3LubuNjp_k8hw.text: Food and service awesome. From the time we walked in and were seated we waited for nothing. Staff and management very attentive and food can I just say it my waist line is gone yummy we will continue to go back. Love everything affordable for my size family and barbecue like no other.

4t4PzQ768_19b6lxJirzjA.text: I'm starting this review early because if you read some of my reviews I do things in advance. This time I needed a big order for my daughters first birthday party. I have a million things to do to ensure everything runs smoothly. I come here on Monday to ask about an order I need on Saturday (they require 24 hours notice). The manager said I can pay on Thursday if I want (I want to get that money out and have that order taken care of). She took down my name and that I need this by 12:30.   I'm not sure what sides I want so I place an order for several sides and the dude at the bar messed it up. My husband, baby and I are waiting.... Waiting... Waiting... I come to the bar to ask about my order. He's like "I'm sorry I thought that was for the order you want to place for this weekend. I thought that's why you wanted the manager." Huuuu... When I went to the Take Out side I told the guy I need 2 things: I want to place an order to go (he took down the sides that I wanted) and that I needed to discuss an order for Saturday. Smh.  Anyway, fast forward to the day of the party. I'm having it at the Gymboree (read my review for that) and I had 30 minutes to set up, so I'm scrambling, trying to get everything in order before the guests show up. My Godmother and Godsister show up early to help out. I ask my Godmother to pick up the food as it's already paid for. She calls me after getting to the place at around 12:45 saying that it's not ready. Ummmmm... I told them I needed my order by 12:30. Why isn't it ready???!!! Perhaps they should have taken my number down to update me that my order would be a little late. Actually, wait... they told me they didn't have my order. And I'm like "HUH???!!!" Uuuuuuhhhh... I paid $300 for that food. THEY BETTER HAVE MY ORDER!!!" She said they found (whatever they needed to find) and that they would have it out to my   Now to the food. Huuuu... Another disappointment. The mac and cheese was good when I ordered a side to go. But ordering this in bulk is clearly no bueno. Along with the chicken (which was dry as shit) and the tea. Everyone kept asking me if it was sweet tea. It was not sweet. It tasted like leftover tea from the bottom of a canister.   The only items that were good were the shredded pork (should have had 3 lbs of that), veggies and baked beans.   I made some rainbow fruit skewers and everyone tore that up! I mean literally those joints were gone in seconds. I got rave reviews about the skewers and the party in general but yea nada comments about the food. I feel like it was a waste. Should have ordered from Viva Chicken. I think I'm done with this place. The food is not good enough for me to order in bulk or even return for a sit down.

2whpSlSLURUvgfFmN0QlvA.text: Came here for lunch and it was great! Customer service was on point and timely and everyone enjoyed their food. I had the smoked salmon (medium) and it was DELICIOUS and cooked perfectly. My friend had a salad so big it looked like he barely put a dent in it ha! Ask for the other bbq sauces they have. Will like to go back and try some other items.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hickory smoked salmon with collard greens. Salmon is ON POINT! Medium done.

bcjaycQoA7BV9NO0dIbUTA.text: We are new to NC BBQ.  This was a fabulous introduction!   The Brisket was amazing and the burnt ends (brisket) were also just as one would imagine them.  Perfect. Great service and beer. Whats not to love.  We will be back!

W0npjPuekj4zfdFKP6Y_gw.text: Had dinner here tonight,  brisket platter and The Hot Mess (messier :)) burger.  Great food and excellent service by Tim and Amanda at the bar.  They were a well oiled machine,  working tag team. Never had to wait for anything,  they were on top of it! Thank you for the great service!

VwEs5kk5MWS-roqgdTp2lA.text: Came in for my birthday and had Audrey as our server, she was so aware and perky and attentitive. No matter what we asked for it seemed like it was no problem for her to get for us. highly recommend!!!

GjLrDZLAKdiDoydcmr6Oew.text: Solid Barbecue spot in Torringdon area.  The service has been good each time.  They have a wide variety on the menu.  The burnt ends and hush puppies are good.  I like their hot bbq sauce.

7unnSVYlHqhK54OH6Pb07w.text: What can I start of with but one the best meals I have ever had! They give out high portions. For an appetizer I got the smoke wings. Let me say this I love them. Amazing literally smoked wings. I could not have asked for a better app. I am so used to Buffalo wings since I am the city over from the original chicken wing; that I figured I try. Yup best choice ever. For the meal I got pulled pork and Mac and cheese (small). That was the most delicious meal ever. The place is pretty cool and they have TVs all over the place. Definitely come here for some BBQ. You won't be sorry!

FxzsLcp5pJgT2DmeN6M_Nw.text: friends took us here when we were visiting and it was legit. Unfortunately they were out of ribs (it was a holiday weekend in the evening) but the rest was really good so it didn't really matter. Got the pig out and got extra brisket and substituted burnt ends (which hands down are the best thing on the menu). They actually missed our extra brisket order and before we even talked to the manager..she brought like extra extra brisket so we got more than we had originally ordered! Now that's customer service! Creamed corn is amazing, Mac and cheese was good, not great ( didn't stop me from eating it all). Overall, really great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hangry smoked Mary, one of the best I&#39;ve had
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

q9GFFIvFmik4lOZ5h_Pn4Q.text: This is some of the best BBQ in town. So happy they opened a location in Ballantyne. The service is amazing (thanks Chris and Tyler) and they make you feel like you are at home.   We came on opening weekend and it happened to be Mothers Day weekend too, they were slammed but still accommodated our large party.   I had the brisket and was shocked to be asked if I preferred the lean cuts, fatty cuts or both (I picked both). I'm glad they offered b/c they both were delicious.   We can't wait to come back to have a beer or two with some good Carolina BBQ!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento Cheese Fries w/pulled pork on top
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

6iPGD8gJxSTqVFZtVFuCGA.text: Just tried this new (for me) place for dinner. Had a great time and the atmosphere was superb. My server was Cristie and she was a great help in deciding what would "go" with what! She helped me chose a great new beer that I hadn't tried before as well and it seemed to "pair" well with my BBQ. Thanks for such a good night!! Way to go Cristie!!

n1G8wYZNRaITuIaPQ6dn4w.text: As family we eat here atleast once a month. Don't miss the their burnt ends!! Best BBQ in Charlotte.

KAbvEJipVzsmZ0J_mt7xbQ.text: Swung by this place for a protein rich snack after church on Sunday. The place has that rustic feel to  it that you would expect at a BBQ joint, and there is a quaint little patio area outside for dining as well.   My fiance suggested the smoked wings, and Midwood Smokehouse didn't disappoint! The wings were smokey and actually seasoned very well without the seasoning being overbearing. The sauce was great, but it honestly wasn't required.   Our waiter was Zach, and although we only ordered two sets of wings and a Bloody Mary, he treated us as though we had a $150 tab. We interacted with several over staff members during our stay that were extremely pleasant as well.   I would recommend this location if you had a choice !

jUoMpxYS1rij-PPRnDB-fw.text: The bacon wrapped jalapenos were exceptional as an appetizer. The brisket was also very good, tender and not over smoked. Creamed corn and smoked vegetables were yummy!! Jackie was a great waitress, friendly, and knowledgeable. I'll be back next time I'm in the area!!

6oSSXfuD5houuIzY-XtsYA.text: Having never been to Midwood, I was really looking forward to my dinner group meet up. We had reservations and I arrived last, of course. I placed my drink order and received it before the others, who then waited another 20 minutes for theirs to arrive. That should have told us what kind of night it was going to be. After looking over the menu, which I will say is a lot, I decided to go with the small pulled pork plate. Others ordered the Cuban sandwich, ribs and pulled pork as well. My platter came with one side, I chose cole slaw and ordered a side of sweet potato fries.  Service was a little off, but we did receive our dinners and unfortunately I received fries as my side, not cole slaw, plus another plate of fries. Okay, too many fries going on. After catching multiple waitresses I finally received my slaw. And, not really sure it was worth it. The pulled pork was great, the fries were crisp and cooked too perfection, but the slaw...very blah in my mind. Definitely missing something.  Overall the others enjoyed their food, but not sure I would rush back to this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small Pulled Pork Platter with Sweet Potato Fries

sEW_SA5S_rL-pVypqD3E8A.text: Fair quality food, horrible wait staff, very stuck up waitresses and bartenders.  They bartenders at this location all act like they are better than you, and the same goes for the waitresses, it is a shame that they act like that when they are depending on tips as their income.  The food quality is ok, they do use the cheap ketchup though, and also charge extra money for such small things as ranch sauce.  If you can skip this place I would recommend doing that.  They do have multiple locations.

AV19Vw8dQjVAUxV8WH5mHA.text: In Charlotte for vacation and decided to try this place out. We were not disappointed! The service was great and the food was delicious! The brisket was very tender. I had the pulled pork sandwich and couldn't finish it. Wish we had this place in Houston!

B2rRaYct544CV3e0fLOwGw.text: I am very disappointed in this place. I have been a long time customer and my experience this evening was so poor, that I will not be returning. If I was the owner of Midwood, I would honestly be embarrassed by the service I received tonight. I waited for a pick up order for over 30 minutes past my pick up time. When the order finally came out, it was wrong! When I asked to speak to the manager, he wasn't even apologetic. It was as if it was a chore to deal with a customer who had every right to be frustrated. He did not offer to right their wrong, in fact he offered me nothing! I got my money back and left. You can do better than this Midwood. Hope it was worth losing a long time customer.

ZRLtuPyaNHAoHR7s5Op0Ig.text: The burnt ends were very good and the cole slaw was amazing. Our waitress was supper attentive and made some great recommendations for our table. Everyone enjoyed their lunch and it was easy to have conversation without having to speak loudly or struggle to hear. I will be back next month when I am in Charlotte again.

a70zyaGEirSj9AdYOIR0oA.text: Great ribs! I snuck in an hour before they closed and was warned that they were out of some things and almost out of the pork ribs. I wanted to try the ribs as they are my litmus test for bbq joints. I got one of the last half racks and they were superb, despite being one of the last ones. They surely sat in a warmer for a long time and were still moist and tender and very good. The spicy chipotle sauce was delicious and the collards were great too. Thumbs up for this place, I'll definitely be back.

0Ck2k_BQPa_Qkuk_g8k8QA.text: What can I say? This place continues to deliver the best customer service experience in town. Amanda was on point with multiple items going on at once. The bacon wrapped jalepenos appetizer was nothing short of a mouth watering delight. Thanks for a great experience.

eKuVlKByVebGgUIl2SAQRw.text: Went for lunch today. 1st time this location. The food was absolutely great. I had the large Brisket plate and I was quite pleased not only with the quality but also the quantity. "Almost" to much  My lunch date had a half rack ofnDry Rub ribs.  Again very good. Very good greens. The pepper vinegar has a bit of heat to it be careful. Glad the meat had such great taste because their sauces are OK.      Our only negative was the way the waitress seemed to serve us. She never seemed to slow down,  even to ask how things are,  she said it moving. But what was really off was that she put down the check long before we even saw the food. It made us feel like,  OK Pay,  Eat and Go.  Not very inviting. But the Brisket was really good.

XwFKTsZkWcaLwJ659V1ejQ.text: While Memphis style barbecue will always be first in my heart, Midwood serves up great BBQ NC style. Brisket was dope, the Nacho Libres was the perfect balance of queso, jalapenos, and BBQ, the only thing that was wanting was their collard greens. Need more vinegar/flavor please. Other than that, this place is solid.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket, went with the mixed, didn&#39;t regret it
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ding! Nacho Libres

KRUs5EExNlOkIB3r6PuJEQ.text: Now this is real southern bbq.   I'm here visiting from NY, and wanted to find that genuine bbq experience.  I don't need to look any further than this place.    When you walk in, you'll be amazed at how big this place is.  Super clean, lots of seating and a large bar.  The decor is pretty neat- bbq themed stuff (check out the ladies room- you will crack up!) also, according to my husband, slave leia from Star Wars is hanging in the men's room which is AWESOME.    Now let's get to the most important part- THE FOOD.  We ended up getting the combo platter and selected the largest portion they offer which is called "pig out".   You get to chose 4 proteins so we did the Carolina chopped pork, beef brisket, pulled chicken bbq, and the saint Louis style pork ribs.  You also get a side of hush puppies with it and a It choice of two sides.   We obviously picked the mac n cheese because who doesn't love that?  The other side was the bacon wrapped jalapenos.  I also ordered the smoked vegetables on the side because those sounded interesting.   (Try the tangy mustard sauce, I put that on the chicken and was not disappointed at all).  EVERYTHING we ate was fantastic.    The manager came over to us to say hello and also explained that the hickory wood is locally sourced, they don't use a gas smoker- This is the real thing here.   We initially planned on wrapping half of our food for leftovers but we cleared our plates.    I would be doing this place an injustice if I didn't brag about the whiskey and bourbon menu.  What's bbq without a good whisky on the side?   It is pretty expansive with plenty of options to chose from.  You can also pick your own flight!    Our waitress Erin was a doll.  She went over the entire menu with us and was very knowledgeable and kind.  Overall we were extremely impressed.  We will be coming back when we are back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

a2Z_MVfCoPUIRaSZMK_V2A.text: So Midwood pretty much ruined my Thanksgiving.  11 people visiting and opened the take-out turkey this morning that I had pre-ordered, only to find that it looked like the smallest turkey I've ever seen - maybe even a chicken?  Weighed it and it was only 5 lb.  $70 for this.  Seriously?  Thankfully, the parents are bringing shrimp from Calabash.    Definitely not going back - ever.
