J7kK1dxSilHmxmmF95vzcQ.text: Food was amazing. Melt in your mouth brisket! I choose the mac n cheese and coleslaw for my side. Wow!  I was alone and sat at the bar. Bar tender was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Very tentative. I will definitely be coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lean brisket

6RTd_nS9SAl5An7M4x-myw.text: Oh how I love brisket and they serve the best in the metro charlotte area. The hush puppies and salads are excellent side choices.  Their salad dressings are homemade and that ranch is addictive.  The desserts are fantastic definitely worth saving room -- specially, the banana pudding and pecan pie which are "grandma recipe level"

sZXotRgToA23LHKoXEHD_w.text: I wish there was a negative number!  Jesus - why all the salt?? Your bbq is so salty there is nothing to enjoy. To all the reviews that came before me.,,,this is the second time I tried it hoping I had caught it on a bad day before......since all the reviews were good. Clearly they are not real reviews, as the food was freaking awful!! No one screws up Mac and cheese like you do either! Worst bbq ever! Go to Lexington!

PubmvPwrKaMTiKApV1RWDg.text: After visiting the Midwood Smokehouse in Midwood, we wanted to try a location closer to us. I have to say we were disappointed on many levels.  While the restaurant was very busy and we were able to get a seat quickly, we felt like we were just being herded around to make way for the next guests behind us. Those running the restaurant on the floor to oversee the operations were clearly visible, giving all sorts of verbal instructions to the servers of what is needed or where. This completely interrupted our dining experience.  Service was basic -- not outstanding. We had to flag down our server on several occasions.  Once the food arrived, it was also disappointing. I had asked for "lean no fat" brisket and there was clearly fat along the edges in several places.  This location does not stand out as one I would like to visit again. Very disappointing.

ICzmpNVr9wDZ09Umja8T0Q.text: Wings are very underwhelming, staff the same, overall experience disappointing.   Need a great wing place in Ballant

a0VSShuJDimh1a6Vs_UNzw.text: This place is awesome!  I like to sit at the bar.  The bartenders Tim and Skylar are incredible.  Very attentive!   Try a nice cold draft and the Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos!   Tell em Jason sent ya!

x6DZ56qdFWfH1BgwHNWQEQ.text: This is a great Midwood Smokehouse location. (But shouldn't it officially be called Ballantyne Smokehouse if it's here?) They have all the same offerings that the other location does except in a larger and less densely packed layout. Also seems to not get hit quite as hard as the original Plaza Midwood location. And for out of towners, it makes for the best southern BBQ.  The menu offers everything they've got at the original. Pulled pork and chicken, burnt ends of beef or pork, ribs, brisket and so on. These days I take it easy on the meats and they make that an option with some salads on the menu. Still, their claim to fame is clear. You can get the Well-Fed with 4 different meats chosen from a list of 5 or 6 including beef, pork and chicken. This also includes two sizable sides (collard greens, mayo OR vinegar based slaw, mac and cheese, and the to-die-for bacon wrapped jalapenos, among others) meaning you will end up quite well fed. If you leave hungry or without a to-go box, you messed up somewhere...  The prices aren't bad, especially when you consider the volume and quality of food here. The service I experienced was excellent, especially since I was visiting with a colleague from out of town.

ZzPXgIUjv3Ap54XPlWEn5w.text: Amazing local Charlotte chain!! Great food and drinks! Their collard greens were the best of all the chains I ate at during my two week stay! Use the spicy vinegar on the collard greens! U have to ask for it!

m9E35IzRwNcLePFAhQYhpw.text: Solid BBQ. Get exactly what you expect, good food, good service, fair prices, oh and did I say good food? The smoked wings have to be the best I have ever had. Also you can't beat their corn bread.   IF YOU HAVE NOT BEEN TO MIDWOOD, GO RIGHT NOW.  *best BBQ in clt*

ZxxdoX6N92xSapJbCS8erQ.text: Place is legit - Texas BBQ in Charlotte ! Brisket and Burnt ends was delightful and tasty. Staff was great and attentive and the vibe was nice ! Definitely coming back to stuff my face.

hf24cdLLGicZqdYL5Krg0Q.text: The baked beans are some of the best I've had. St Louis style ribs are very good as well!

Mn6e0C0GSlJ4ctGqorhDVQ.text: Updating my review and knocking Midwood Smokehouse down to three starts because the portion sizes keep getting smaller and smaller while the prices stay the same. With all the BBQ available in Charlotte and the surrounding area, there just is no need to spend $20+ a person on small portions at Midwood Smokehouse. Hard pass.

adf2Oy4ar4ENlxopoh3zFA.text: Excellent BBQ and really good service.  Now, bear in mind we are from CA and don't get a lot of either of those things - but even so, we liked Midwood so much we came back for a quick lunch the next day, before heading to the airport.  Definitely get the burnt ends - either beef or pork - you won't be disappointed. The sweet potato fries were the best I've had. The creamed corn was also excellent!

YOuDkAQ_rL_VBrTBrw1Ttw.text: I cannot express enough of how awesome HECTOR& JAMIE are! My wife and I just moved here to Charlotte from Hawaii and we came to Midwood for some BBQ. Best decision ever. Jamie our server was so polite and every attentive. Food came out fast and delicious! A+! And then the manager Hector came over to us and was taking story. He was so nice and friendly! Made our experience here amazing and definitely coming back for more. He made us feel like home. Nothing but great thing about this place and would recommend everyone to try this place out! Thank you so much hector and Jamie!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

aHft3g7Q81O_Lzafm1MarA.text: Placed a to go order for a couple of half chicken meals. The chicken was juicy and flavorful. Big fan of the SC mustard sauce (and that's saying a lot b/c I'm a NC girl!) All of the sides we had were great - baked beans, mac and cheese, smoked veggies, and coleslaw. And, of course, the hush puppies were on point. Came in and my order was waiting for me at the bar. Super easy pick up. No complaints here!

oQEy8VbUcxnd3IqGs0dgng.text: Visiting NC for the first time from AZ I had to get some bbq before I left and I am so glad we found this place! I'm no expert of bbq but this is why I can never be full vegan :) We found this place by accident and it was heaven scent, best rack of pork ribs ever! Great beans (with meat in them I think) and fine minced coleslaw with a stash of pickled onion on the side and hush puppies too! We shared a full plate which was plenty and washed 'em down with some craft brews. Finished the meal with a small bowl of banana pudding and boom! Even bought the shirt! We can go home happy now knowing we had the best meal in Charlotte. Drop what you're doing and go here now!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding puts this place over the top
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spare ribs to die for

r9X_x7g8slLjfduJgPSdQw.text: My favorite barbeque in Charlotte.  If you had asked me a few months ago, I would have only rated it a 3...because they had removed the smoked, creamed corn from the menu for a while.  It is back and I love it!  My favorite time is to swing by after church (Calvary Church...shameless plug) when the Panthers are playing.  I enjoy the first half of the game with my family and then head home at half time!    My favorite dish is their smoked brisket with collard greens.  Get their pepper sauce!  If the color is bright...it is new and not too hot, but if you want good flavor, look for the more muted colors.  They have at least 3 types of hot pepper in the sauce, which makes for a yummy taste.  The brisket is tender and smoky, and really does not need sauce, but the sauce is tasty too.    The bacon wrapped jalapenos vary in heat...be warned...sometimes you will get a tasty one that seems mild, and then sometimes you will get a heat bite...still tasty, but be aware.  Oh, and the pecan "cobbler" is rich and yummy...plan on rolling out of there if you get that.  It is football season, see you there.

1jvQtSDJdK2xD_3knjr0gQ.text: We ordered 5 items on the menu tonight.  The Midwood Chopped salad was as you'd expect.  Nice mixture of veggies.... All good.  We also got the Hogapeno dip which was surprisingly not hot at all... But good.  Loved the pickled veggies!  They had some kick.  Our favorite were two tacos... The brisket and chicken.  Both very flavorful and unique.  Cameron was our rockstar server.... Great, great guy.  We finished up with the cookie pie.  YUM!!  Great place.  Service was awesome.  Food was delicious and reasonable.  Loved Midwood BBQ.

Vww6AMx4ivZ2V6zAYFfywg.text: Outstanding bbq and food. Thst could easily beat Bobby Flay in a throw down. This must for bbq lovers.

efo18Oqz4wrXSU-ADm7MMw.text: Always love everything I have ordered from here from the burnt ends, dinner specials and pulled pork! The cream of corn side is delicious and I love their salads. This place has not disappointed me yet!

wtLcBFOSmNWQXVlrdz00Tw.text: I went for dinner on a Saturday, it was busy but we were sat right away. Luckily had the lovely Ivy as my server for my first time here. She made excellent recommendations. She recommended the Pom Fire as a drink and it was absolutely amazing. I had the Hot Mess and it was also amazing. One of the best burgers I've ever had. I probably finished it in record time. Super cheesy southern style Mac n cheese as my side. I already can't wait to go back and try more. Ask for Ivy!

a_2pCx1TdyROWLP5DecMVQ.text: This is the best place for BBQ beef brisket...seriously, I have tried almost everyplace in Charlotte. Sooo juicy and tender, nice smoked taste. Every time I try another place Im disappointed because its never as good as this pllace

yNQIQod5bzVEQmQuB7ZILQ.text: What a fantastic feast I had. I enjoyed my meal completely and the service was so friendly. I will surely be back for my tasty meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great tasting sandwich.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. An AMAZING and TASTY Dinner

kC2cnTdeeWfSu2Y-rqPjFw.text: I went to college in Texas, and in my time there I tried a lot of very good BBQ joints. This one blew all of them out of the water. I had the Sat./Sun. special, a beef bone with about a pound of meat on it. The meat was fall of the bone good, and it all but melted in my mouth. Their BBQ sauce choices were also excellent. For sides, the Mac n Cheese was as good as one could hope from a quality BBQ place, and the creamed corn was the best I have had.  The service was very good, and when our waitress heard it was our first time she was happy to give recommendations and let us try all of the sauce options with our meal.   All told, I am very glad they sent us a first time $5 off coupon, and I will certainly return.

ztKMgb5_r7n91Q--egUvNg.text: Usually when you are in walking distance from your hotel that equals poor food options - NOT the case here. Instant classic. Amazing staff/service - out of this world NC b'que - mac n' cheese/hush puppies....hold me. Went twice in one day. If you are near their locations and want legit NC Barbecue, do yourself a favor and stop in.

dU1Gkb7ZIyfLSAlM_CJjhw.text: Normally I only have positive things to say about Midwood. I usually order a brisket plate but this time ordered a brisket sandwich. What I got, instead of sliced brisket, was chopped brisket drowned in sauce. Smoke flavor is buried by the overdone sauce. Service was good but I would never order a sandwich there again.

LjC0Hp_wQ2QL5vj46vGbVA.text: I had the brisket with collard greens. The brisket was so good and tender and juicy. The greens were delicious. I felt the portion of brisket given was small. They offer a small plate and large plate, but that's based on increasing the number of sides from one or two versus the increasing the portion of the meat. They offer a combo plate but you have to choose at least four proteins, and I can't eat that much.

WMWmFQpUG5nh3lPMGU3MjA.text: This BBQ was great their special was a Bbq french dip WOW it was a beef brisket smoked perfectly . The cheese an au jus mouth watering. Only thing I was disappointed on was their Mac n cheese an im finding this a lot lately. It was that power mix cheese an than they just mix it with the noddles an bake it YUCK!! I'm a southern girl I know my Mac n cheese of its on the menu it needs to be real or just add a side that you do know how to make.  I'm surely goin back one friend didn't care for it but didn't try the brisket she said she wants to try it again. Check it out minus the Mac n cheese

_M1Se1-lqVepwSXNE9cg8w.text: Fantastic! I got the blackened salmon sandwich with roasted corn, red onions, tomato and coleslaw on top. Delicious! The French Fries were so so...  My husband got the lean brisket plate with coleslaw and hush puppies! He thought it was all mouth watering. Great place, pretty cheap; the only thing I really didn't like was the seating. It is very snug. You can almost touch the person at the next table.  *Stephanie K-I can't figure out how to message you back. Because your food is SO outstandingly good I think the restaurant is packed all the time. I'm a small woman, but even I felt way too close to people. We were seated in the back of the restaurant...the very far back wall area near an exit door. It was a row of two seater type tables against the far back wall. But...that said, the food is worth it! I have raved to quite a few friends, and my mother in law flew in from California and was absolutely delighted with the sampler platter!

SlnNsAHZbzwlKdgQSYpVNQ.text: My wife and I shared an order of smoked wings, I had a plate of burnt-ends, and she a chopped salad with brisket.  Wings? Brisket? No, this is not traditional Carolina BBQ. They have a fairly good selection of beers and food was good. The atmosphere has a touch of a corporate feel to it, but the service was absolutely fantastic.   Did I feel like I had died and gone to BBQ-heaven? No, but definitely not a bad place to go if you have a hankering for it. Overall, I would recommend it.

q1Z1lQs_g4RHRqL8f9WbSQ.text: Fast service, the guy at the bar was on his game at lunch and served up a well poured beer after taking my order. Food was fast and delicious all in all a great time. 10/10 will munch here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Good times

0Xr2FmBMpknvTictZ1Erkg.text: Best BBQ in Charlotte...maybe even in all of NC.  Fantastic food, great atmosphere.  I recommend the pulled or half chicken.  Try to get there early on weekends, as it gets crowded very very fast.  Came back in February 2017 and tried the craft cocktails.  Very Very Good!  I recommend the brambler drink.  Excellently made and a good amount of alcohol

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

2hTZvVwKKF1lUuEjIvMJ8w.text: Awesome! Delicious, best barbecue in the south! Amanda, best waitress You will love all the meats but the hush puppies, Cole slaw are fantastic. Please open one in Greensboro!

Kt46yTAo0fgZUp1Wv8AjHA.text: Disappointed! I love Midwood and usually eat the location on Central Ave. which has never EVER disappointed me in my 6 years of living in charlotte and eating there. Went to the Ballantyne location and my Mac and Cheese was dry, my pull pork sandwich barely had any meat on it, the burnt ends were not as tasty! I give it 2 stars only because the baked beans were great! The Ballantyne location is nice and pleasant however if you want EXCELLENT food the real Midwood way go to the location on Central for the real smoked, southern, good taste of food! Ughh! So upset!

nIupFFGq_wEDvvpCFocU7w.text: I went in for Lunch on Sunday with my daughter and both of us were happy. She praised the service and enjoyed the food and I too felt the same.

jiq-Eknk93b3z_OF9knefQ.text: WORST BBQ/DINING EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE!! Ordered the bbq, was absolutely horrible. I could not even eat it. I tried my wife's food, also nasty. This place is so overrated and just plain SUCKS. Their macaroni was acceptable, but the bbq was purely unpleasant. Very soggy, oily and just a bad taste with nasty sauces. I have had way better bbq at Shane's Rib Shack, Sonny's and the Golden Corral. Midwood is thriving on the herd mentality of people for now. Those who assume that they must have good food if they are busy. There are too many options that are far better. I took my food home, reheated it and tried it with Sweet Baby Ray's. Still was plum nasty. Hopeless. I didn't even want to complain because I was done with that place.

K32kF7kNiSZYlOXlSY4M4A.text: Our group from work had lunch at Midwood today. The place was packed but our group of 6 were seated fairly quickly for a Friday.  I ordered the Small Carolina BBQ plate and side of sweet potato fries. The BBQ was delicious, moist and flavorful. Fries fantastic.  Our server Amanda was amazing. Even though the restaurant was packed she kept refills coming, table clean and packaged up to-go items with fresh containers of sauce. All done with a smile.  Wish I had saved room for dessert - maybe next time!

_wSdZc4sDlxQsAVsOYgrSw.text: The staff was excellent as usual. The food is the best BBQ in the Charlotte area by far. Love this place!

xJnoboaT5XqMIPF9PqQtWg.text: I would never come to this location again. Don't get me wrong, the food was great; however, the hostess was completely inappropriate to my husband and I. We walked in for lunch one day with our baby and the hostess started to ask us all these questions about our child, which we were totally fine with. Then she proceeded to tell us 1. Our baby was way too young to be out in public, how dare we be out grabbing lunch 2. That we don't have him "bundled up enough" (it was 60 degrees) and 3. She even made an extremely rude comment about my husbands weight to him! We are new parents and we felt totally "parent shamed" by this complete stranger. This was in the span of 5 minutes where she sat us down and then wouldn't leave our table. She completely over stepped her boundaries. Her job was to simply take us to our table! The waiter was pretty great though probably trying to cover up her idiotic behavior. Horrible experience. We will never come back because of her extremely inappropriate behavior. Management- do yourself a favor and reprimand your hostess.

R2O5gobTkXgmk5U-HQ_pJw.text: I was so disappointed with my meal at Midwood.  After all of the rave reviews and multiple recommendations from others in Charlotte, I was expecting really good BBQ.  I'd say the sides were better than the BBQ.  I got the pulled pork and brisket.  It was under flavored.  The BBQ sauce was decent, but it just wasn't good enough to season the underflavored meat.  The creamed corn and the pecan pie were the stars of the meal.  The hush puppies were dry and flavorless.  The baked beans were good too.  Overall, a very disappointing meal.

VYbUwa8nmx3QtSb1w3Pa3A.text: I came here for dinner one Sunday the atmosphere was very nice and enjoyable the food was good as well I just wish the barbecue sauce was thicker

-CGKWy0zAeSTUHU9RKq0_w.text: The new Midwood Smokehouse speaks for itself when compared to the previous BBQ joint that resided in this space.  I remember coming in before Midwood took over and having my pick of the tables at lunch - now you have to wait 5-10 minutes on most days.  Service is however still quite fast, and my colleagues and I are typically able to get in and out within the hour.    Have tried several different options and enjoyed them all.  The mac 'n cheese is a bit too cheesy for me, but the smoked veggies and collared greens are both delicious.  Had the Abilene Press today and enjoyed the brisket and melted Gouda.  Will definitely be coming back for more BBQ when back in the Ballantyne area!

frvh9c1IR0mfpRUtAxP-JQ.text: The place is very clean and very cool.  Abigail served us and she was awesome.  Great server.  We had ribs which were good but would like just a little more tender.  Not falling off the bone tender.  That's too much.  I like my ribs to have a little bite.  Willing to try them again though.  Chicken was awesome.  Beans out of this world.  Red slaw pretty good.  Greens awesome.  Bacon wrapped jalapeno good but would like bacon crispier.  Hush puppies awesome.  Banana pudding really good.  Pecan cobbler.  Oh my.  Sooooo good.  Going back there try burnt ends and Mac and cheese.

uS-y30B5df6WF8uPTggZ9A.text: We have been to Midwood Smokehouse many times, but never on a Saturday night during the heart of the dinner rush. Wow! They were slammed! With that being said, we waited the 20-25 minutes they told us we would. We were seated, with our waitress showing up shortly thereafter. She wasn't rattled or rushed and got our drink order out quickly; she took our food order, and our meal came out fast, considering the crowd. Like with any other time we've been to Midwood, we thoroughly enjoyed our food- my husband got barbeque and I got chicken tacos. More than enough food and always consistent in taste. We spent $25 on 2 meals, not including tip. People were waiting outside and several deep when we left at 7:15. Worth the wait! Apparently they now take reservations, which we will remember next time.

zfzhW_Ujwa_HKyHCtPrlWw.text: I ordered takeout from Midwood and was so disappointed. It was awful. The pork tasted like someone had poured liquid smoke over it and it was dry. The sides were not good either! I actually threw away the entire meal and ate a pb&j at home. I was so disappointed because I had heard great things!

4bu_0yXDzrNFMMgvCvWNWg.text: My favorite BBQ place in CLT!  I have eaten at the Ballantyne location a few times and it never disappoints.  I have eaten at the Plaza Midwood location many times and it is excellent as well  I have had the Burt ends as well as the pulled pork sandwich.  Both are great. I highly recommend the stuffed jalapenos - they are awesome.  If you are looking for great BBQ then try this place

ZK7MEwFzjgDDl2v2syk7Mg.text: Visiting from Atlanta & we knew we had to get barbecue from Charlotte! This restaurant had quick efficient service & SUPERB food. I ordered the Gingerjack drink & the St. Louis ribs with a side of mac & cheese & collard greens. It came with hush puppies as well. Everything was hot & delicious. Our server Matt was wonderful & had great suggestions & informed us newbies well! Next time we are in Charlotte, we are going again!

jVBSsKH3Vqs9Ptd3uKSFcw.text: Generous portions and flavorful well cooked meats. I had the chicken barbeque sandwich and it was overflowing! The slaws were nice as well and the sauces were delicious.

i92-4Hj4_vmd7ly6LAVT8g.text: That Sunday special need rib is so ridiculously good. The house salad is awesome and so is that avocado dressing. Sides are pretty good. I don't even care what the rest of the menu taste like I want to go just for that rib every time.

F1KYxHHSwYl8VyvRtMlePA.text: Great place! Brisket is my favorite. Also the queso brisket dip is the bomb and so is the hogapeno dip YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dab on em! Midwood Smokehouse.

V2d6-3rN7C2sQc9qCxN62A.text: Really fast service. We were seated quickly and our waiter was very attentive.  I had the beef brisket dinner and my friend had the burnt ends dinner. We got our food in about 10 minutes.  The beef was tender, the smoked veggies were amazing, and the hush puppies were just the way they should be. They had a Carolina BBQ sauce and their house sauce-- both were delicious.

6EJlAOLA4MP-zsuw-JNXTQ.text: Excellent service, very friendly staff welcoming & attentive. Consistent recipes, resulting in delicious meals.  Well balanced flavors in the rub & the smoking of the meat.  Impressive beef brisket & Mac & cheesr

Y1B0ZnWlJTaDM1mR4diYow.text: So... I really wanted to like this location, but it's just not as good as the Central Ave location. For starters, the food isn't consistent each time I come.  I've had good Mac and cheese here and then I've had horrible Mac and cheese here. The staff is definitely friendly but it doesn't make up for the inconsistent food being sold here.  Also, this location doesn't have the fried Mac and cheese which the Central Ave location does.  There are two main perks with this location.... 1. I haven't had them run out of food, like the central Ave location. 2. The place is definitely more spacious.  All in all.... I would visit again since it's close to my job, but when it's the weekend, I would rather go all the way to Central Ave than to go to the location that's 10 minutes away from my house

5hRgNOjWTvAPdGreGoqpEA.text: Stick to the PM location. Here you'll get lower quality service and food with noticeably smaller portions

a30XRbAYwZZKBp1S274Ghw.text: We had family night here Monday night. Our waiter Andrew was awesome. He recommended pull pork, and tacos. Which was delicious.  All the food we tasted was good. Thank you Andrew!  The manager recommend "banana pudding " yo this is soooooo good. If u come here please try their banana pudding and their pull pork.    This is my family new spot when we are in Charlotte nc.

oJNcZORL6CO3Kn50tcA0BQ.text: After all the reviews I was excited to go...but unfortunately let down. Went with the entire family but every sauce was too spicy for the children to be able eat anything. Meat was good but not great...I've had better BBQ for half the price...maybe I went on a bad night.

K1oySfE7L-Zqrh-p4pfiyg.text: Awesome food! Awesome people! Awesome drinks! Different location, but still 100% awesomeness!!!

UBfgYUIdpjB_8tXdfiSbfA.text: Not my first time at Midwood Smokehouse, but my first time at this location. I've been to the Plaza Midwood location a few times and decided to give this location a try as it's closer and newer (I think). The parking lot is pretty small, especially if you drive a big truck. We were quickly greeted and sat, even on a Friday night. The booths were large and comfy. The one we were at in particular, was round which was really cool! Our server (I wish I caught her name to give her a shoutout) was so phenomenal. From the moment we got there, she was so welcoming and asked if it was our first time and since it was for a few at our table, she took time to explain what they're all about.   We tried their special of the day as an app, which was a jalapeno cornbread skillet with a sweet butter on top. Wow was that ever good! You don't totally taste the jalapenos in the sense of their spiciness but it definitely added to the dish. We tried a variety of things for dinner and everyone had great things to say. They give you plentiful portions, so much that mine turned into two more meals for myself.   This is the first NC BBQ place I ever tried when coming to Charlotte and it has remained a steadfast favorite. I recommend this location based on their service, restaurant size and quality barbecue

EosFy8OjTJ8hoX74uZZGBw.text: I love any of Midwood smokehouse's locations. It has some of the best BBQ in the CLT area. Their nachos are AMaZing and their BBQ is always delicious. My husband enjoyed his ribs and Moscow mule. We will always be back!

o4NpXmfNmdmn00WCAL536A.text: We have been to BBQ joints from California to South Carolina and in between. Midwood ranks right at the top of all of them. There burnt ends are the best. The Mac and cheese is baked and has some crunchy crust pieces in it that is so much better than the creamy dripping kind elsewhere.  The bacon wrapped jalapeno's are perfect. Just enough heat to them. If you are craving BBQ this is the only place to go.  Can't wait to return.

VsXMFHAYNg992DyYBcvrWg.text: In town for work and decided to order take out from herHad the 1930 cheesesteak and can only say "wow"!  That's a great bbq version of a cheesesteak!  The bbq baked beans were spot on as well.  Highly recommend this place!

YZ3CNhu1KOgIH1c3tSh7JA.text: Ate here a couple of nights ago. The food, drink, atmosphere and service was top notch. I travel and eat out a lot. For bbq and drink, this was one of the best I have had.  I thoroughly enjoyed the smoked brisket, which was  served clean. No sauce. It's that good. The Bourbon flight options were perfect and the service was even better than the food.  Go and enjoy. I hope your experience is even almost as good as mine.

eoEGBRxQ6KH4xJYAGE3LRA.text: 1/2 smoked BBQ chicken is over cooked. Thigh and leg were dry. I didn't dare try the breast and wing. BBQ beans tasted like they were leftovers from a picnic. Mac and Cheese were leftovers too.  Waitstaff were great  Price for leftovers $$$

OFiCjrjmUFRnZuQGI3uCdA.text: Wow a great find!  This BBQ joint has some amazing burnt ends.  Melt in your mouth, delicious BBQ.  The coleslaw and wrapped jalapenos were great too!    They also give you these little hush puppies that are so tasty.    If you are looking for solid NC que, this is your place!

wWMAqfFmdDRALhUq4iF-6g.text: Great spot for lunch and dinner. My favorite dishes are the BBQ Chicken and Burnt Ends. It's a popular spot.

pfbqWVB5vN4qWaU03bRz1w.text: Although Charlotte isn't known for barbecue, a lot of new barbecue joints are popping up in the area. These places are much different than the old school joints like Bill Spoon's. For example, Midwood's original location is a full-size sit-down restaurant much like this location in Ballantyne. I typically prefer to get my barbecued meats to go or at least in a fast-casual setting. However, Midwood is great for larger groups and special occasion celebrations.  The prices are higher than some of the other places but the quality of the meat is similar. The brisket is very good but probably not the best I've had. The pimento cheese fries and bacon-wrapped jalapenos are popular appetizers and we almost always get the former. On Saturdays and Sundays, they offer a 16 ounce beef rib for $28 and it is outstanding.  Our service has been excellent except for some miscommunication about a dessert on our most recent visit. They advertised a seasonal peach cobbler but we received their normal pecan cobbler. It was good but just not what we expected.  If you're in the area and  want a nice sit-down barbecue meal, Midwood Smokehouse is a solid choice.

hO2YyY_YjBwERMfii-hGWQ.text: Thumbs up to this BBQ place in Charlotte. The beef brisket was very flavorful. I will definitely eat at this restaurant next time I go to Charlotte.

2RouCNi_yBOV9hjHVWvX2Q.text: We stopped in while visiting family in the Queens City and it really os a great place. Our waiter was knowledgeable of the menu with great recommendations. We ordered the burnt ends and they were outstanding. My 4 daughters ordered rack of ribs and backed beens. Pulled pork sandwich without coleslaw. Cheese fries. Kids pulled pork sandwich and fruit. They loved it all and they are picky as he...... The wife ordered the half bbq chiten all white meat and loved that also. I got the pick 4 meants with jalapeno cheese sausage, ribs, burnt ends, and brisket  and it too was outstanding with double mac and cheese. Try the sauces as it brings out a great new flavor to the meats. We finished with banana pudding and other than not being as cold as i like mine it was great. Give this place a try and you will keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Full rack ribs baked beans
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork sandwich
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ chicken all white meat macaroni and cheese collard greens

g3kCVheTomnfwNvxmYTn1w.text: One of my most favorites places for Barbecue and banana pudding. We have order catering from them on many occasions and they never disappoint.

hmmDLj1M2Sh1YwlKp2EBCQ.text: I was on a road trip with my girlfriend, her two kids, and my two kids heading from Cleveland to Orlando for a vacation. Along the way I was determined to find a BBQ shack for some good ol' Down South BBQ. Unfortunately, I never found it. What I did find, while stopping for the night in Charlotte NC on our way back home, however, was Midwood Smokehouse.   I don't know if Midwood qualifies for "real deal" Down South BBQ or not, because, like I said, I'm from Cleveland, and my idea of BBQ is maybe Famous Dave's, or Old Carolina Barbeque Company, or even Michael Simon's Mabel's BBQ (but Michael Simon is from Cleveland too, so he's probably not an authority on the subject either), but what I can tell you is this was some darn good food.   We arrived on a Saturday night at about 5:30, and the six of us were seated immediately. Had we arrived 10-minutes later, I bet the wait would have been 45 minutes. Seriously. By the time we left the line was out the door. This place is really good.   I ordered the Chicken and Ribs combo (1/2 chicken and 1/3 slab of ribs) with Mac n' Cheese and Baked Beans. I don't know if I've ever had better as far as the chicken and ribs are concerned. Portions we're huge. I couldn't finish, but I relished each and every bite that I had.   Our server, Walter, was also top notch, and definitely the reason for 5-stars. He took his time to explain the menu, their smoking process, the different sauces; had a little banter with each of the kids. He really made us all feel welcome. Really great guy with a great personality for dealing with the public. It's often a thankless job, so this one's for you Walter - THANK YOU!   I may not ever get back to Charlotte, but if I do, I know where I would stop if I want great BBQ and even better service. Midwood Smokehouse for sure.

vzDH42cEd7BnWlVjPs3wSw.text: What a delightful experience I had here.  The BBQ was really quite good, but the experience was made even better by our server, Christie. She was helpful, without being overbearing and really created a pleasant atmosphere that combined with good food will ensure my return!  The BBQ at Midwood is the real deal.  I always get the brisket because it's juicy and flavorful. The vinegar based slaw is really good, as well as the Mac and cheese.  I'd highly recommend this place for anyone looking for good southern BBQ.

9duZ285ZVpxuEhdEsA4yhw.text: Atmosphere is traditional BBQ and family friendly. Clean and smells like good smoke. Service was great and explained the menu as it was our first time. Explained the proteins and each sauce for which it goes. Ordered the well-fed plate with Ribs, pulled pork & chicken and brisket with Mac and cheese. Food was good and lightly sauced. Able to spilt with 2 others. Side salad perfectly dressed. Overall good food great service. Ribs were slightly overdone but still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small chopped salad
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sauces
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Well fed combo

Jp1Msq4ABkhRin8boLS5vQ.text: Coming from a home that regularly smokes bbq, this was pretty good bbq, but could use some tweaking. We visited during lunch time with our family.   The jalapeno wrapped bacon appetizers arrived super fast but, I'm kind of leery of food being too prompt as my mind wonders if it's been sitting under warmers. However, it was delicious with ranch dressing on the side.   Beef ribs plate w/vinegar based slaw and collards. On point!  Smoked wings crispy style. First, I had asked what the crispy means. It means twice fried. Honestly, my wings were shriveled up and dry with barely flavor. Crispy yes!   The selection of sauces are slim, and lack flavor. I feel like they need something memorable for sauces. Disappointed about the sauces, i look forward to trying them.

TFWeRxKq6sn8YjPvDNGCyg.text: Ive been here a few times and the first time was not good. however the subsequent 2 times ive been pretty impressed. i was not impressed with the brisket sandwich for lunch, but for dinner, dont miss the burnt ends. Just. Dont. However be warned, they have "pork burnt ends" which is not a thing. I dont know what it is...but its not a thing. Beef Brisket Burnt ends are a thing they do very well and you should get them every time you go.

bsYzrqsXea7H4f1UyDuztQ.text: Yep, this is your place for BBQ if you're in the area and want smoky, delicious meat in your face. All the meats are great, but their burnt ends are ridiculously delicious. Plus, they have Cheerwine in a glass bottle and a fantastic whiskey selection. Who could ask for more? Delicious sides: mac & cheese, baked beans, bacon jalapeno, and the hushpuppies. The creamed corn didn't do it for me and I'm not a fan of the pickled onions. But it doesn't matter, because the meat is amazing and that's what's most important. Also, the staff is super duper friendly and they have a separate gluten free menu for those who need it.

ScR3z9X6bMUnW_alGiMzUw.text: I like Midwood, so I took my visiting Parentals. It ended up being a marginal visit. The good food saved a rather 'meh' experience.  The waiter started off very knowledgeable about the beer selection and then the service sort of dropped off from there... Having to ask several times for ice water and a specifically requested sauce is frustrating.  My parents definitely enjoyed their meals. I'm pretty sure they would return, just with hopes of better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is what happens when you forget to take a meal photo and they make a really good salad topped with pork.

gHkSz88-eHESC3TLrhpxXQ.text: This new location is a just a shadow of the original. It lacks a lot of the things that make the original location great. The character of the Plaza Midwood location is gone, and this location feels like any chain place in the area.   While the food was pretty good, my wife and I had a generally bad service experience. Our waitress was far from attentive, so ordering and getting refills was a tedious process. The worst thing came hidden in our chips and queso: random nasty, burned pieces of fryer garbage were strewn throughout our chips. Apparently general kitchen cleanliness is an issue at this location. Worse yet, when we brought the issue up to our waitress, she barely apologized and didn't comp it at all.   Overall, I won't be back to this location, even if I'm in the area. There are too many food choices in Charlotte to settle for mediocrity.

V2mNk9cSoYPArKuwbWKCOg.text: Visited the new Ballantyne location of Midwood Smokehouse yesterday for lunch. I was by myself and figured the location would be insanely crowded, but decided to walk in to see.  I've tried to talk my husband into going, but he's always adamant that he likes to give new restaurants "a month or so" to work out any kinks before he tries them. Since he was off doing something else for the afternoon, it was my chance to try it without him.  The restaurant was busy, but there was no wait and there were seats available at the bar. I grabbed a chair and ordered a PBR ($2.50 drafts!) and after a brief review of the menu, figured I'd try the side dishes/veggie combination plate instead of going for actual barbecue on this visit. I figure this way my husband can't get TOO upset that I went without him for my first visit!   I ordered the creamed corn, cole slaw and stuffed jalapenos. I was originally going to get hushpuppies as one of the items but Chad, the bartender, assured me my dish would come with a few since the platter of sides was considered a "plate". When it came out devoid of hushpuppies he noticed instantly and said to the foodrunner,  "We're going to need a side of hushpuppies and pickled onions for that." They were delivered right away. Thanks for having my back, Chad!  The creamed corn was delicious. I chose to believe it was "healthy" in spite of the clear abundance of well, cream, in the dish. I was least enthusiastic for the coleslaw, but it ended up being my favorite item on the plate! The 3 jalapenos were delicious, but a little small. I'm used to a friend's bacon-wrapped jalapenos which are not halved, and are enormous.   Some people have written that they find the hush puppies too sweet. I find them to be just perfect, no ketchup needed to enjoy! I also loved the pickled onions. I devoured everything on my plate quickly, and found it to be just the right amount of food. I've never had a chance to try all the delicious sides I've wanted, so this was a great opportunity.  Chad made me feel welcome and was very attentive, getting me a second PBR just before mine went empty. We shared some Words with Friends strategy during a moment of downtime, as he saw I was playing on my phone.  I was very impressed just watching Chad work. He handled a few carry out orders, and as each one showed up, he opened up all the containers to quality check them, and went back for a few items with each one. This restaurant, being so new, probably still has a little confusion going on, but he made sure every order was right, whether it was mine or the carryout orders.  All told, my bill was $12.99 for a delicious meal and 2 PBR's. The value for what I received can't be beat!  I was originally thinking I might be uncomfortable eating solo at what is so clearly a sit down family restaurant, but the bartenders were all very friendly, and it was such an enjoyable lunch I definitely see swinging by for more solo lunches in the future!

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie/side plate with creamed corn, cole slaw, stuffed jalapenos, hush puppies and pickled onions.

VXSWvDWr3qteTY0Gcn6u9A.text: Omg. Great Q. Green goddess dressing was perfect. Brisket was cooked perfectly. Our server Jaime was attentive and friendly. Atmosphere was great for talking.  We went last year on our yearly visit and loved it enough to come back at our next visit. The bbq sauces had a lot flavor - made the whole meal. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Q4PS0ncxj2emHWSJgwDVzA.text: Got the half rack of ribs in the spicy BBQ sauce and they were good. Not dry at all. Pickled onions are great with it too. Got the macaroni as a side item. Overall, food was pretty good. Service was a little slow but we did go there the first month they were open.

-JK4Txgkft66rjoeKii-5g.text: Brisket is the best. Stuffed jalapenos great. My favorite BBQ joint in town. Mom loves half rack ribs. Dad really liked philly steak sandwich.  Just try it,  I'd be shocked if you were disappointed.

Lwuxnu9uo-NCJtgj8uD-jg.text: This was my first time at Midwood Smokehouse and honestly I don't think there's anything special about the food. Our service on the other hand was outstanding. My boyfriend ordered the Carolina pork which he couldn't even eat because the after taste was terrible. The waitress then told us that the after taste was probably the vinegar that was in the pork. We hate to make any trouble but we just couldn't stand the taste of it. She nicely offered to take it back and get us something else. My boyfriend then ordered the burnt ends. He liked it much more than the Carolina pork but still it wasn't that great. As for me, I got the 1/2 chicken. The only pro was that the serving was huge but I was disappointed that the chicken barely had any flavor. I had to constantly put salt and black pepper on it just for it to taste ok. The cream corn had a weird taste to it and I just didn't care much for the collard greens. The only thing I probably enjoyed was the hush puppies. I didn't want to cause more trouble than we already have so I just tried to eat what I could.  Even though the food wasn't great, I'm giving this place a three star for their service. They took the food back with no trouble and constantly checked up on us. Everyone was very nice and our waitress was very understanding.   To conclude this, I probably won't be back just because the food was mediocre. But thank you to Midwood Smokehouse for the great customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 Smoked chicken

OjE46Z6kgBLtURzowLLGgQ.text: We ate here 30 minutes before they closed, I was wondering if it was worth getting the mashed potatoes this close to them closing. Ended up getting the mashed potatoes and  they were very fresh, everything was fresh and very tasty.

dP4AYZaX7K-voT8n3rgBlQ.text: As big fans of the original Midwood Smokehouse on Central Avenue, we couldn't WAIT to visit the new Ballanyne location, just 15 minutes from our house. And despite waiting nearly 40 minutes for a table, we were not disappointed. The brisket and pulled pork were both cooked to perfection, the mac & cheese was delicious, and the hush puppies completely irresistible. As at the original location, the beer selection was outstanding, with a wide variety of local crafts on tap and an extensive menu of bottles.   My only real complaint was the lack of seating in the hostess area, which made the long wait for a table more unpleasant than it needed to be -- especially with the kids in tow. But otherwise, the Ballantyne location is another fantastic addition to the Queen City's 'Q' scene!

GR2I5M1OT_jFj7t-9ca9rA.text: Cristie was an amazing server. The experience and the food combined were untouchable. I will definitely be back to see the restaurant along with cristie.

0pdlEyDca7ewb7Wnel18kw.text: Nothing really special to report here. The BBQ was ok. The beers on draft were plenty. The service was hit and miss. I have been to much better BBQ joints in Charlotte. Unless you don't have any other choice, and in this town you do, I would pass.

3HBcCghZtt1M0ngBne8xkw.text: My recent experience was outstanding! The beef brisket was by far the best I've ever had. The service was outstanding, cristie did an amazing job, very polite, she NEVER let my drink run dry! Never had to ask for extra napkins or anything she was very attentive. I will be back!

mWgq2bzEibRY453YuY3OEw.text: First time at this location. I've been to the Original location a lot. We walk in the server was in over her head and there was nobody there. She sat the bigger group that was behind us entering the building before sh sat us... A smaller group. The table she sat us at was avail when we walked in, it took about 7 minutes to get our table. The water they served us had a bad taste. Our meals were not as good as the original location. Burnt Ends & BBQ Plate.

P8u2NgTXrN91yu4jbNhhCw.text: Food oustanding!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  It Could be best in Charlotte. Briscuit to die for Atmosphere = perfect. Service = waiter had a serious listening problem and multiple things were wrong.

n08Zkis0WtVppQT18L9IkA.text: Good BBQ and variety of other foods. I had a salad and it was huge! Definitely get the bacon wrapped jalapenos! Does tend to get very busy and doesn't take reservations.

iKKZ54BhvuQUKwa_F3gvpg.text: We were a party of five for dinner on a Saturday night.  Everyone was very happy with the food.  We were seated right away and service was very friendly and attentive.  We would definitely go back.

9PpeGnGclaDIvRXosmvVDw.text: This place is really good. Way better than the previous Sticky Fingers. This location is definitely better than the NoDa and the service is way more friendly. We ordered some brisket in our combo plate and when they had sold out they let us do double ribs for free (normally a decent size up charge to do double ribs). Their collard greens are definitely my favorite side.

_dabLSCrOR2uEIj6XjhX1Q.text: I've been to the NoDa version of this place twice and while it was good I have to say the 521 location is better. Our waitress was spot on and she took care of us the whole way. I almost let go of the steering wheel she was so good.   Just as a preface...I smoke bbq at my house often and have eaten it all over the country, just look at my profile pic. I've actually stopped eating bbq unless it's a special occasion because so many places are let downs. This place isn't a let down so start driving now if you're considering.   We started with the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeno's which are money. I don't order straight up bbq anymore so I had the taco's. Well thought out and executed as I would do them. I had to do the hushpuppies and they were worth cheating with fried foods. My son did the brisket sammich, I tasted it and they did a good job on it.   It was lunch time so I didn't order beer but they have a cool bar with tons of different beers. I may have to come back after 5 for some beers.   I will go back when in the area and so should you...always good to have a legit bbq joint in the hood near me. Just an FYI my dad went here three days ago on my advice and did order the straight up ribs, pulled pork and brisket. He's into bbq too and said it was spot on.

j30isU1oLngBwDDOENBlWQ.text: Delicious!  We had the pimento fries with beef brisket and jalapenos with bacon n cheese as appetizers.  Everything was perfect and flavorful.  Had the combo with mac n cheese and greens.  Taste homemade as if grandma was in the kitchen cooking it herself.  Manager was very personable and meeting guests.  Waitress was as sweet as pie, answered all our questions and very patient as we were first time guests.  Great recommendations.  Will definitely be back.

YRNFnfKEqvG3jbHUiS2qfw.text: This is my favorite BBQ spot in Charlotte. Ive been to both locations and both be swinging. I always order their smoked wings and their platter which comes with your choice of meat and sides. Their beer selection is good too as I always rock out with a apple beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings and bacon wrapped poppers.

KQDAJbyxlbmZ4HlAt2MNeQ.text: Such a fun atmosphere upon entering this resturant. I'm pretty certain we tried just about everything on the menu between the four in our group! Everything was wonderful, from the meat selections to the sides on to dessert. Portion sizes are huge so be prepared to either share or have leftovers to take home. We were there on a Sunday mid to late afternoon, our server was excellent. Our friends had previously shared how great their dining experience at this location so we couldn't wait to give them a try. We certainly were not disappointed in the least. They have a full service bar as well as numerous draft beers on tap from local breweries. It's nearly impossible to pick our favorite menu choice as everything was so good. If you've not had the pleasure of enjoying Midwood Smokehouse you are missing out!!

eLUADUvkuFajOYKZxjv7OQ.text: Holy smokes, this BBQ is amazing. I've never been huge on BBQ, but one day I tried Midwood in Plaza Midwood and it rocked my world. I tend to find something on menus I love and stick with it, and I struck gold my first visit. Their 1930 Cheesesteak is ridiculously good. A Philly cheesesteak with brisket, genius. The girlfriend usually orders the burnt ends with the Cheerwine BBQ sauce, and I've snagged an end once or twice. I'm happy to report that Midwood isn't a one trick pony. Hers is always fantastic as well. To top it off, they offer a fairly extensive list of beer, wine, and spirits. You've done it Midwood, you lit the fire inside me for pork BBQ. You're the new yardstick by which I judge all other BBQ. Hats off to you Midwood. Well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1930 Cheesesteak

h0h8R_AFthXBosFqs1PfgA.text: So technically this Midwood smokehouse and the one on Central Avenue are both hella good. The issue I have with this place, which is why I am leaving four stars, is that they are more expensive than the one on Central Avenue.   I made the mistake of ordering something that I would normally get at the other one and it cost about nine dollars more here. Needless to say I was fuming. I just chalked it up because I never looked at their menu prices because I thought they were all the same. When I told the lady about it she seemed to have a very nonchalant kind of f@$# you attitude. Obviously the food is good enough that I returned because this one is closer to my house. But still... At least you know.

gMOxnhc9c3m_zo_wNHtB-w.text: This is right by our house and has always been a good quick stop for us.  We always sit at the bar so we can here the staff interacting.  You feel the pulse of a place sitting here.  Pork BBQ is good.  I love the hush puppies.  Wife loves that she can find something healthy while I indulge in the good stuff.

7fcYyS_ZQewBNs-SvSsGHg.text: I really love my BBQ, so my dining mate and I had lunch here  Comfortable atmosphere, extremely attentive waiter Walter.  Menu of beef, chicken, and pork sandwiches , entrees, bbq plates, appetizers,   tacos, salads and a variety of sides, bbq sauces, and 2 yummy dessert items, banana pudding and pecan cobbler.  Menu prices reasonable, food nicely plated,  and served hot. Walter told us everything prepared  fresh on premises except the fries. We ordered the hickory smoked bbq chicken with 2 sides. I got the sweet potato fries and coleslaw, my mate the baked beans and coleslaw. Hush puppies and pickled onions came with the chicken. The chicken was delicious and tender, coleslaw mediocre, baked beans delicious as well as the hush puppies and pickled onions. Sauces  for our chicken were mustard based and a sweet hot Midwood sauce. 2 other bottled sauces on the table were heated in plastic bottles. I asked how they were heated, yes in hot water, not the micro. We would return to try other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. smoked chicken with sweet potato fries and coleslaw
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. smoked chicken with coleslaw and baked beans
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. art deco

qvE7JHHqutKKLXMuuCptfw.text: We got here around 6 on a Friday and the parking lot was packed! We were worried that we'd have to wait a while for a seat, but the place is definitely bigger than it looks and we were seated right away. There was more of a crowd closer to 7, though. I was dead set on getting a brisket quesadilla, but I think I saw an outdated version of their menu, so I got the Midwood grilled cheese with brisket instead. I'm not sad at all I had to pivot because it was delicious! The cheese pull was real. I poured the Midwood sauce on it and it was fantastic. I got that sandwich and a side of sweet potato fries for less than $10, which I consider a steal!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midwood Grilled Cheese Sandwich (with brisket) and sweet potato fries.

FD7cIFyDY-csxGF0k3hD9A.text: Ladies and Gentlemen.... We have some seriously DELICIOUS BBQ here! No joking Midwood smokehouse literally blew my mind, and not only did it blow my mind but it was raved by the group I was with last night that swore up and down that Texas had the best BBQ. I believe that Midwood Smokehouse made some converts!  I came here with a rather large group probably around 14 people and the staff was great and the restaurant accommodated flawlessly! Of course with such large groups everyone of course was not seated at the same time.  Everytime but noticed that no matter when another couple came the servers were right there to get drink orders in big props to the FOH Crew. Now here was what really blew my mind with a 14 top everyone's orders came out about the same time and was just still hot and delicious,Big big props to the BOH Crew. I'm sure that's not a easy task.  Now for the food yeah anything on the menu is going to be really good. Your standard pulled pork I've had before and it is  banging. But last night I tried the Burnt Ends mainly thinking the name sounds absolutely disgusting, well rest assured it's anything but! Seriously those burnt ends were just soooo good My mouth is watering just thinking about them.   If you're in the area and looking for some probably some of the best BBQ in Charlotte don't need to look any further.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midwood Smokehouse

ai1-p12w-fBVDRXfW5Adsw.text: My husband loves barbecue so we decided to stop by here while we were in Charlotte. I ordered the 4 oz grilled salmon for $12, which was decent and mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was dry so I decided to get the smoked vegetable, which was absolutely delicious. I was surprised they used fresh vegetables instead of a frozen medley. My son ordered the cheeseburger for $9 and it was a very decent size. He also ordered the mac and cheese and liked it. Different taste buds I guess.  My husband ordered a half a slab of ribs and fries for $16. He thought his ribs were okay but not the best he's had. We are from the south so we've had some pretty good barbecue.   The North Carolina vinegar sauce wasn't really to my liking. My favorite barbecue sauce is usually the Carolina mustard sauce, which was just okay. I was surprised that I wasn't a big fan of it. The house sauce is actually really really good. The waitress was really nice and so was the host, even though they forgot to call us when it was time for us to come in. Overall, pleasant experience.

DGwjeenypkrfnoQSQK6dfQ.text: 5-star experience for sure!  We thought we were going to the location with 1000+ reviews, but we ended up here and so glad we did!    We shared the "Well Fed Combo" meal which consisted of large portions of ribs, burnt ends, chopped pork, brisket, hush puppies, and 2 sides (stuffed jalapenos and creamed corn).  We also ordered the banana pudding (heavenly).  Everything was so absolutely delicious!!!  Hannah was so very friendly and attentive, and gave great suggestions which we took her up on.  We're sure no one else could've been better!  Thanks, Hannah.    Super clean from dining floor to bathrooms.  We will be back...to THIS location!

EVT2yzx4tXFeNUGm4tkR6g.text: I give this place 4 and a half stars. Our server was amazing. If it was just based off service I would say 5 stars. She was very informative, friendly, and attentive, without being overbearing (I've had servers that will literally be breathing down your neck or completely ignore you). She was a perfect balance! Now the food...I feel like the amount of food for the price is definitely worth it. You get your "bang for your buck". I enjoyed my chicken and I loved my fries. It is one of the best crinkly fries I've had. It wasn't over fried or soggy, it was just right. Our server recommended the mac and cheese. My boyfriend loved it but I didn't care for it. That's why I didn't give this place 5 stars. I thought it tasted doughy. The texture just wasn't there for me but everything else was great. I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked 1/2 Chicken with Classic Mac &amp; Cheese and Crinkle Cut Fries

s7PwFfrTxrnVeKggNPTeYA.text: Beer and barbecue in Ballantyne. If you like smoke this is your place. We recently felt ourselves in the mood for bbq and decided on Midwood as we were in the area. This is a fairly large place and has a good aesthetic. The beer selection is extensive with a lot on tap. We ordered the burnt ends and bbq chicken. The burnt ends were basically brisket tips cut from the edge of the brisket then tossed in a sweet bbq sauce. It was quite good actually, very smokey though which for me was great. The sides were done well. The service was friendly and we received our food quickly even though the place was pretty hoppin. The experience was good all round. Highly recommend.

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked chicken with beans and smoked veggies

zQYThoRUG5zJoz1CsOte5g.text: First let me start by saying I went to the Park Road location, but I am sure all locations are very similar if not the same. I don't typically like smoked/BBQ food, but this was chosen by friends so I thought I'd give it a shot. The brisket was delicious! I got it on a salad, which was filled with fresh lettuce and other vegetables. We also got the cheese fries and BBQ cheese dip, delicious as well! Everyone else loved their meals too. Service was also superb! Like I said, I typically don't care for smoked/BBQ food and I am already looking forward to going back! I have also been to Mac's and would choose Midwood over Mac's in a heartbeat!

FcYwFhORchrRC6OcHWYEWg.text: We met some friends for lunch in Charlotte today at Midwood Smokehouse.  Everything was very tasty.  I had the half smoked chicken with collard greens and Mac and cheese.  The chicken was delicious, but I have to save the Mac and cheese was awesome!  My fiance had the burnt ends....said they were perfect, with a great smoke flavor.  Service was spot on, and the atmosphere was nice.  We'll be back next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Barbeque!

WYBBF0DDgRsw1wKLIH3kYw.text: Came in around 7:30 last night with my gf.  Promptly seated and had 10 star service by a man named Walter I believe.  We received our food and drink within 10 minutes and was out the door in another 15.  Food was perfect we did the pig out.  Will do again.

4UNq06ZavssKPBxgugWc4g.text: Went to Midwood Smokehouse to meet up with a friend.  I ordered the beef brisket with lean and fatty parts with a side of baked beens.  I absolutely LOVED the brisket!  Our server ( who was sooo attentive, and patient with our chatting it up at length before ordering) suggested the Midwood sauce with the brisket if I desired sauce - and he was right!  The combination of the beef flavor, smoke, fat, and sauce was absolute heaven!  The baked beens were good too, but I didn't much care for the charred/burnt pieces of meat in it.  This was my first time at this location and I really enjoyed my visit... The music selection was also spot on...just sayin'

Jq2nzg8vRfdSW_oRFwU3KQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse has the best BBQ (pulled pork and brisket) in Charlotte!  You cannot go wrong!  From the creamed corn, hush puppies, Cole slaw, sweet potato fries, Texas toast, or banana pudding!  Love the vibe of this particular location as well!  Friendly service, roomy booths, and awesome food!!  Get the "Pig Out" combo and have a family share meal with plenty of leftovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pig Out Combo with pulled pork, pulled chicken, and brisket!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pig Out Combo!!

SxfcfxhDWu92_-hy7Z-j0g.text: After some extensive searching on Yelp, I knew I had to try Midwood Smokehouse while I was in Charlotte. I'm a sucker for good barbecue and was excited to give Carolina-style barbecue a try. Midwood Smokehouse has three different locations in Charlotte, but I chose this one because it was closest to my hotel.  I arrived around 7 pm on a Monday and it was pretty empty. I sat at the bar and the bartender was incredibly nice and helpful, and made great suggestions on what to get. On Mondays they have $3 off all cocktails which is a great deal. I got the Bramble On cocktail which was delicious and refreshing.   If I wasn't alone I definitely would have gone with the Combo Platter, where you can choose 4 different meats. Instead, I decided on a small platter with Lean Brisket. The bartender also suggested I add one of their Smoked Sausages and for my side I chose Mac and Cheese (of course). All I can say is WOW, it was all fantastic. The brisket melted in your mouth and I liked that you could choose between lean, fatty, or both for your cuts of brisket. You also have a choice of 5 different barbecue sauces to compliment the meat. I went with the spicy one for a little heat. I'm really glad I added the Sausage on the side, it was stuffed with jalapeno cheddar and couldn't have been more tasty. The Mac and cheese was delicious as well, not the best I've ever had but I don't have any complaints.  Sure dinner was a little on the pricey side, but it was worth it! I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small Brisket Platter (lean) with Smoked Sausage, Mac and Cheese, and Hushpuppies
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bramble On Cocktail

LkBtfZb24daFjURHP1XmSg.text: Came here for lunch and had a great meal. Split the Pig Out Combo Platter option with my boyfriend. Options for proteins are: Carolina chopped pork, beef brisket, Saint Louis pork ribs, pulled chicken BBQ, and Hickory smoked sausage. You are supposed to pick 4 proteins, so you only have to decide which one of the 5 options you do not want. We decided to skip the sausage. The ribs were incredibly tender and effortlessly fell off the bone. I enjoyed the ribs the most, then the brisket, then the chicken, and then the pork. All of the meats were juicy except for the pork, which was dry. You are also given 4 sauces: South Carolina mustard, Eastern North Carolina vinegar, and Midwood signature and spicy habanero. I absolutely loved the Midwood signature sauce. It was sweet and tasty. The spicy habanero is mildly spicy. The mustard is just slightly too overpowering for me, but if you love mustard, it's great. I didn't care for the vinegar at all.  The meal also comes with 2 sides in addition to hushpuppies and pickled onions for $34. We opted for the mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos. Mac and cheese is usually our go-to side, but this was one of the few times that it disappointed me. The pasta was too chewy; it just needed to be cooked an extra minute longer. The cheese was not melted and gooey, but rather, clumpy and unappealing. I wish our meal came with more bacon wrapped jalapenos instead of only 3 pieces because they tasted great! Same issue with the hushpuppies; the meal only came with 5 pieces but I wish I was given more. The hushpuppies were dense and delicious. The pickled onions were great to mix with the meat.  Service was fantastic. Our waiter periodically checked on us to see how we were doing and if we needed anything. Boyfriend received soda refills without ever having to ask. Bathroom is decently clean. Parking was easy to find.

-rALGIhXd8wUli_VMuCBQw.text: Food was amazing. Service was great. My wife and I came up here for Carowinds and decided we wanted some bbq we went back and forth on the places in town. Finally decided we wanted Midwood. Couldn't have chose a better place. Will definitely be back. Better then the bbq in our hometown!!

mxIIS3QaLrGZxKU6wNYZqg.text: My husbands go to when he wants a burger, fries and a beer! Their Hot Mess burger is the best in the city! If you aren't out to impress your guest & they don't mind getting elbows deep into dinner, BRING THEM HERE! Seriously friends! This burger is so damn good! Juicy, flavorful & always cooked to perfection. We get it with fries. Mac n cheese is okay, but if you ask for extra crispy fries you won't be disappointed! Also worth noting is the wait staff know the menu & beer list. They make sure you have everything you may need BEFORE that burger from Heaven arrives.

kij2BG7f7LE3oVQtC2Mb-A.text: It was my boyfriend and I first time here. It was so amazing. Our server Nikki was so sweet and kind. The food is so great, we got full really quick. The salmon was very delicious and cooked to perfection. All the bbq sauces were delicious. I'm definitely will come back in the future. The bonus is that I came on my birthday
