Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hickory Smoked Salmon

pvFqY-JSAhzSvpYnZIuk0g.text: I had some business to close in south Charlotte a couple weeks back and had a later than desired evening meal.  The first thing that I thought was that it might not be that great because its in a retail shopping plaza. The atmosphere for having bbq should be one step removed from a tin shack, with a ceiling fan stuck on high speed and a dog barking in the background. Well, Midwood is nothing like that, but the interior decor suggests that they are serious about their food.   I ordered a pulled pork sandwich, slaw on top (natch) with crinkle cut fries. Absolutely delicious! I had a couple of beers and a nice chat with some locals across the bar from me. Normally, I write longer reviews, but I only had time to visit once so here are my impressions based on just one visit.  I liked the atmosphere and decor very much. My sandwich was very good, and a good value considering how big it was. The bartender was friendly. And, one of my biggest concerns about any restaurant is cleanliness. Midwood is clean and so is the restroom! That is a good sign that management is on top of things. Based on my one visit, I would recommend Midwood to anyone, and if I am in this part of Charlotte again, I will be sure to stop by.

NkhwHVYXp7ijjJNsHhfGGw.text: Have eaten at both the plaza midwood and Ballantyne locations. Have had great service when dining in and taking out. Nice beer list. Have enjoyed their brisket and pulled pork sandwiches. Love the different sauce options and their mac and cheese was pretty good. Definitely recommend for someone looking for a good BBQ dinner

4UzXGpBtzdIqE07PQ8cWRA.text: Went here once with my family, and everything came out cold and when a restaurant brings out cold food, I am sorry I can't really forgive it. They did take it back and give us new warm food again not hot and it was terrible. Save your money.

_NbQ3qJaOuYcRslFg5NkKw.text: I'm going to get soooo fat with this place only a few miles from my house!  It's no wonder this place is multi-award winning.  I want everything in my belly!! Service was outstanding, TVs everywhere (there was a Thursday night football game on and I did not miss out!) and the food is fantastic!! Their sauces are not just the normal Carolina vinegar and alternative ketchup based, but they have 4 options, my favorite being the smoked jalapeno awesomeness.  Wings are big and meaty and grilled, so you can pick your bbq.  I had a monster sized salad with shredded pork that lasted for the next day's meal too.   I will be back to make sure I have one of everything on the menu....twice!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large salad with pork. Couldn&#39;t finish it in one sitting!

XqxMGrncBUQXD04Ae54n8g.text: Fo Real!  Amanda at the bar is the reason we come here. The food is great but Amanda's service is top notch. She provides fine dining service at the bar.

WYUrlGlattI-qwV_C0rhcw.text: This place has great barbecue. Meat is smoked to perfection with a variety of sauces to choose from. The wings are one of my favorite things to get. This place has a great atmosphere with friendly service to go along

8L_zq7SBUmOX1ELxr8o75g.text: Ate here the other night and it was my daughters birthday and we had Cristie for a server. From the beginning she was bubbly and super helpful on explaining the menu because it was our first time here. The food was AMAZING! Everything came out fast and the portions were huge! I would recommended this place to everyone

AxPmYo9bywSqVXHkJLTwcw.text: Midwood did not disappoint.  My buddy and I saddled up at the bar on a Wednesday evening and were immediately greeted by the bartender.  She promptly took our drink order and offered suggestions for dinner.  I opted for the "well-fed" combo platter - Carolina Chopped Pork, Beef Brisket, St. Louis style Pork Ribs, and Pulled Chicken with mac & cheese and smoked veggies on the side.  The portions were HUGE.  Everything was prepared to perfection and did not disappoint.  The meats were tender and flavorful.  Sides were more than satisfying.  Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo platter

AEzrPwDRF_mVChj0A314SQ.text: I just had some of the best pulled pork barbecue I've ever had. The Midwood Smokehouse is a comfortable and unpretentious place offering nicely smoked and barbecued chicken, pork, and beef. Service was prompt and friendly and the pulled pork barbecue was moist and lean. The coleslaw was excellent as well. If the fries were a little crisper It would have been a perfect 5-star experience.

cG_eR1D_4fo5aRMkDqhprw.text: Always packed and for good reason. You know a restaurant is awesome when they have bacon wrapped jalapenos as a side. Midwood shares the title of best BBQ in Charlotte along with Mac's Speed shop, although I can't say one is better than the other because they both do different things really well. Midwood could get a 5 star rating with their baked beans alone. The beer selection is great and food is even better. Prices are extremely fair for the portion sizes. Their meats are all outstanding. Mac n cheese could use a little makeover, but overall it's not bad. Both locations are fantastic. If heart disease and obesity were not legitimate concerns, I'd eat here everyday.

PdWRj1h32g45DxEifeiFKA.text: What can I say? Everything here is good! Seriously. Smoked wings, ribs, burnt ends, cuban sandwich, brisket. Never been disappointed. Good sides & good service. Highly recommend.

MqXg6jDDJiRdM7puXpUVgg.text: Was here after Belly Dancing class Tuesday night. Who knew that belly dancing was such a work out? Famished and headed over Midwood Smokehouse. The place was pretty empty when were got there and it was late in the evening. Nice ambiance and atmosphere I would say. Feels like a bar with bar food. We were sitting by a bar.   Food review Sweet Fries- Yummy. Not greasy Brisket Sandwich- There was a small piece of bone, be careful chewing the meat. It was okay. Interesting mix with blue cheese. Have not acquired this combo taste yet- BBQ sauce with Blue Cheese. Mac and Cheese- Too salty for me Banana Pudding- Really good and tasty  Floor towards the bathroom was slippery. Bathroom was clean and pictures hung up like actors in black and white photos was it from the 70's, 80's or 90's?

Ps4DYto4i5JaLp3lY2d8iQ.text: Came here for burnt ends brisket.  Exceeded expectations.  BBQ beans and Mac-n-cheese as sides.  I savored every bite, I was in no rush to finish, which is nice change of pace.  Got pecan cobbler to go to allow the palate to realize how good this meal tasted.  Glad North Carolina has embraced beef!!  Matt S provided great service - thank you Matt.

aIQRNWTFgY86vuADXR4TCw.text: Love bbq and tacos at Midwood. I enjoyed the meal and the service here. The original location has more character but the food is equally delicious both places. The parking is definitely easier in Ballantyne.

OFS7W7mLxo8cLcpp9SKNXg.text: Really disappointed. I've been eating at Frank's restaurants since he went into business. This by far is the worst run! I called and inquired as to the wait time and they said that there wasn't one. We get there 10 minutes later and they said it would be at least 45 minutes . Hostess seemed totally indifferent. Too bad. Too good a restaurant to fall victim to poor staffing.

aZmW2XOrE-VOsZCcJ79htA.text: This is my favorite place to get BBQ! The brisket is insanely flavorful and juicy. The chicken isn't dry and the nachos are out of this world! Great bar selection also! Come almost every week! Great atmosphere, friendly service and make you feel at home! Never had a bad experience here! 110% best place to be!

5qS_T9dGRu6TIwQiCAnlrQ.text: Ugh so disappointing. The other Midwood got such great reviews and I had my expectations set so high for this one, clearly too high. It's been open for a month or so now, but I haven't been since yesterday. I was really excited to get some good barbecue and went to Midwood with a friend on a Sunday afternoon.  The inside of the place looks great. Lots of wood colors that you'd expect at a barbecue place and a good amount of TVs. The bar even had power sockets which is a fantastic touch.   I got a half rack of ribs with the dry seasoning (per the waitress's advice, usually I go with wet ribs) and hushpuppies on the side. The food came out quickly, and the ribs looked delicious from the outside. The best ribs should be able to be eaten with a fork and no knife at all. These ribs did not pass the test. Lots of the meat was very tough and required heavy knife and mouth work to get it off. Not good. The taste was average. I didn't love the dry rub, but the sauce it came with was excellent. The hushpuppies were fantastic--not too heavy or buttery.  Our waitress was pleasant but really nothing more, maybe a little bit rushed. I wouldn't be running back to Midwood, but it would do in a pinch.

cQCql_qng9bvqZeNcm5GTg.text: The Pulled Chicken BBQ,  Mac-n-Cheese, and Midwood Chopped salad were delish!  The Sweet tea is good here too if you are a native southerner...otherwise you may want to cut it with unsweet tea.   Next time, I have to try the Habenaro sauce and remember to save room for banana pudding for dessert!  For your next big party or corporate event, you may want to check out their catering and bulk pick up options.

Yt9QsOaWRbLgjaSx1xIoLA.text: Visited Midwood with a colleague, and we were both impressed with the food and service.  Salmon Tacos were amazing....perfectly grilled with just right amount of smokiness and the slaw was a great compliment.  Our server, Audri, was attentive and  helpful without being over bearing. She was polite and knowledgeable. Atmosphere was casual with a large slice of easy going.  Definitely enjoyed the experience.

2LYNjgH3oc5OmnotDgw43g.text: You don't really bite the ribs, just open your mouth and the meat falls right in. EXCELLENT service on every visit, great local beer selection

LZPp5p3-mfdaeWtw-OiR1g.text: Decent cue but kinda pricey. The pimento cheese fries with pork is outstanding and the beer selection is good. I was disappointed that there are no bottles of sauce on the table. I guess you have to ask.

3ebRoQFH5wl50vyTjoz9cA.text: Giving this place two stars instead of one because I will give them the benefit of the doubt that I just got a bad dish. I got a plate of burnt ends with hush puppies and creamed corn. The burnt ends were burnt all right. They looked like lumps of coal on my plate and were nearly as inedible. They were rock hard and extremely dry and chewy. The hush puppies and creamed corn were nothing to get excited about either. I was looking forward to trying out this new Ballantyne location and they let me down :(

-_VJIj2kCbMQL03LYSAodA.text: Violet - VIOlet - VIOLET was awesome! We have been in Charlotte 48 hours and everyone has been nice but Violet understands her customers, is very attentive, and made the perfect recommendations for our food! Wings (dip in Habernera BBQ sauce! Result = Great! We visited 6 Bars yesterday and had every intention on doing the same tonight but VIOLET! Not only her but the kitchen staff made great wings, Management frequently asked how we were, and the Locals have been fantastic! This place has AMBIANCE man!!

EuHw0ngCChmRa7i1ZohaPg.text: This is my first Yelp and I felt after eating here I needed to warn people about this Sub par bbq place because there are so many better options for NC BBQ in the area. Felt like i consumed a salt shaker with sub par service.  Had to stop at a gas station to get water after our meal, i was so thirsty.  Sides were good.  Mac and Cheese, BBQ Baked Beans, Fries, Hushpuppies (although on the small side).  Ribs were meaty but oversalted so there were hard to finish.  Same with the Chopped Pork.  The brisket was fatty.  The only thing that was worthwhile was the sausage.  Don't know why people would wait here to eat because you are better off going somewhere else for BBQ.

I4oKhKQkGmBI3LDFwkqPDQ.text: Fantastic food and service.  We tried the Mac and cheese, baked beans, collard greens, bacon wrapped jalapenos, fat and lean beef brisket and the hush puppies. Good food almighty it was all great.  The collard greens had big chunks of ham hock, the beans were spicy and the Mac & cheese was cooked to perfection. I would recommend going with the lean brisket and not mixed. We will be back!

q6zUw7ZUHf0e6ROnLa9vKA.text: Was there a few days ago and was really looking forward to trying this place but ended up disappointed. Had the brisket sandwich.  Menu said it was chopped but the texture was more like they threw it in a blender and pureed it.  They also served it with bleu cheese on it, which sounded strange but I figured it must be good or they wouldn't serve it.  I was wrong.  It was not a good combination at all and I found myself looking for mints after my meal to get rid of the aftertaste.  In addition there was hardly any brisket in the sandwich.  In fact I think there may have been as much bleu cheese as meat.  My friend had something else and simply said their meal  was okay.  Was expecting more for the price. In addition the meat tasted strangely like it wasn't really smoked but just had some artificial smoke flavoring added.   Wanted to love this place but that isn't what happened.  Went back about a year later - Was better.  Got the burnt ends and they were pretty good, along with some collard greens.   Nothing amazing but pretty good.

kdMvwOZDWFRrEFC46aHZjA.text: Cory from customer service contacted me and asked me to give this midwood location another try.  This is a follow up to my prior review...  Went in for lunch on a weekday and sat at the bar again.   Was greeted and served immediately.   Order was taken and food arrived promptly.   My wife ordered a pork sandwich and I had the pork plate.  The pork was great.  This time the fries came out hot but still not as crisp as I like them.  They were good just a little too limp for my taste.  Cole slaw was good.  Hush puppies were great.  And I loved the pickled onions.  Two complaints:  1) the music is too loud for lunch time.   2) again, why no self serve sauces?  But those are minor complaints. Overall great food and a much better experience than my last time here.

EUhgoiTSJU22pUjd1zVVvQ.text: Overrated!  Had a burger.....Sounded delicious on menu but it was lousy.....Chewy!!!!!    Gross......I managed to eat about a third and left there hungry.   Fries were mediocre at best....What a disappointment this place was!!!!!!!

3YxUmeMpbIGmr0JZVHmmTg.text: Have had the ribs at this location twice. The first time they were good; last night they were bad. I may return, but not anytime soon.  Service was very good on both visits.

EbQ19JoI-MiZRVdSY4Gd6A.text: Fantastic barbecue in Ballantyne!  (I haven't been to the Plaza-Midwood location so I can't compare the two.)    The burnt ends are delicious; the beef brisket is amazing; the chopped pork is awesome.  I have always gotten excellent, friendly service here.  I brought some foodies from Chicago here- they admitted they were skeptical at first due to the squeaky clean strip mall location (which is, of course, how we roll in South Charlotte)- but they totally freaked out about how legit the food is.  I love this place.

CeVUOV0B3QhPSzPrQ5TMJg.text: This place has great BBQ and atmosphere. The staff is friendly and fast. I've also been to the Central Ave location several times and was pleased when they opened a closer location. It can get very busy but that is because they have great food!

k4fVv0-2lp9LkH-HNoRcCA.text: I love the "fatty brisket". Is it a chain??? I really don't know. I don't usually love chains, but the brisket is perfect every time! I used to go to the one in plaza before this one opened-always good! It's a place I go OCCASIONALLY bc the food all kinda has the same smokey smell and taste. But it's a place I  can depend on for yummy brisket.

1_QgG4CjvYRQ_0U0CmQiiw.text: The food and the large portions were good and filling, except for the house salad already heavily laced with pepper when it arrived. If I want to spice my food, please allow me to it. The music was insanely loud and I had great difficulty hearing what my friends were saying right across the table from me. If the music level goes down, then people won't have to be constantly yelling at each other in order to be heard. Thank you.

GEJ2sFIrFjcUSZP_hvuslA.text: A solid average.  Tried pork and brisket both dry, honestly my wife makes better pork BBQ with the crockpot.   The bar seating is a bit irritating.  The bar has elevated booths in which the hostess has to seat you.  However the footrests are set so far under they are effectively useless leaving your feet to just dangle.  Atmosphere is nice, good selection of beers.  As a BBQ joint that folks want to rave about can't say I will be in a rush to go back.

mCGAU7wB695H_lHuwcfx_A.text: Good service. Burnt ends didn't live up to description. Ribs were juicy and flavorful but overall they had an overwhelming black pepper taste. Macaroni and cheese was a disappointment.

Vq9kH2kFTuNEJe1ENElc0g.text: Went tonight for the pre-opening. Wait staff very professional and eager to please. Food delicious.

FjIn0rrfCeKnR-B2ijh22A.text: This was my first visit so can't compare it to the original location.  The place is nice, open and clean. The server was pleasant and attentive. Had the burnt ends and the sauce was really tasty.  Could have dealt with less fattiness. The macaroni and cheese was creamy, cheesy and browned cavatappi (corkscrew) deliciousness.  Was too full for dessert, but have to return and try the pecan cobbler.

AyAQAUDO74Dsk5YmH88tHA.text: I love this place , but the only complaint I have is the restrestant is always cold. But there food is superior . And the staff is very friendly , I just hope that next time I go there hopefully it be warmer lol.

BqNkFDPmrC_xYHr8Wi7Qig.text: 5 stars go to Priscilla the Bar  person she was excellent pleasant and courteous and efficient I ordered the number one sandwich I forget the name of it that was brisket with Gouda which surprised me that it had Gouda in my opinion the brisket should've been  stand on its own and it was served as a Panini rather than the sandwich which again I was surprise  I will go back but I would not order that sandwich again I had brisket recently at a place down further on 521 the city barbecue brisket by itself was excellent

C1IvYmfc2PS5ZX2pzUZmxg.text: I moved from Texas, so I was on the search for brisket, because apparently beef bbq is a rare quantity in Charlotte.  I took the advice of some reviews and grabbed some brisket to go after calling in an order.  A little on the salty side (though that may have been me) and before I drove away I had a piece out (no sauce, let's not be insulting to the meat) and man oh man delicious.  It definitely sated my cravings for brisket that's for sure!

CEPZHd8y4wAzm7QyJLyYGA.text: Solid and consistent BBQ. I love the brisket grilled cheese with the Mac n cheese. Great staff and service is always attentive.

R7V0_LErvcCq1qotjaOrQQ.text: This is my favorite bbq place, that I have ever been to. The bartender is so nice, I think her name is Amanda, but don't quote me on that. The food is always consistently amazing. Only once did we have a bad experience, and the manager comped the entree. If you like quality bbq at a great price, this is the place for you

3pYxT8kMMTqlC2Oigf19zQ.text: Sadly this restaurant did not live up to the expectation set by the original.   We went last weekend with a couple of out of town friends and everything started off well. I had called ahead to make sure if there was a wait it was reasonable and when we showed up we were taken straight to a table. Great since we were starving! Almost immediately we put an order in for the cheese fries with brisket. The fries came out after we had ordered our mains and several of the fries were burnt.   Moving on to our mains I had ordered the big plate of lean brisket and a friend had ordered the half lean half fatty. When the waiter was handing me my plate I asked to verify that he was handing me the lean and not the mix (since my friend and I had the same sides). He said it looked like the mix so my friend and I swapped plates. Halfway through the meal we realized it was right the first time so we traded strips of lean and fatty. However I wasn't super invested in getting any more brisket since the strips I already had were dry and unimpressive. The brisket at the original location is one of my favorite meals in Charlotte.   Overall it was a fine experience but as other reviewers have mentioned it felt more like a chain than a delicious and authentic NC BBQ joint.

SMpqwu0RK_m1siPA72_4Vg.text: So far our fav smoked pork place. I like the taste of smoked pork and these people do a good job of smoking their smoke, not just pulled pork as some places give you. Great smoked meat doesn't need a sauce in my opinion. We split a large platter, each getting our own side and more than enough food. It was a bit chilly in there is my only complaint.

19Uex6u8nMl5uMbYs26Z5A.text: Great all around BBQ. Beans, Mac and Cheese, and pulled pork were excellent. Brisket and ribs were cooked perfectly but would like a little more pull to the ribs.

DgkXxmrOx0ArS_4UOe07mg.text: Had four coworkers in from Michigan and I needed a solid go to restaurant.  Chose Midwood and no one walked away hungry or dissatisfied in anyway.  Always quality food and the service has always been good when I go through.  Thank you Midwood.

GY3dZnr12OP92LFj56kydw.text: Fantastic restaurant with ample choices if you're living the ketogenic lifestyle.  Dry rub ribs are amazing.  Fatty beef brisket is keto heaven.  Add a side of collards or smoked veggies to round off the meal.  Oh, and don't forget to order the stuffed bacon wrapped jalapenos.  Hands down one of my favorite restaurants.

l948m3n1PzglViSbHAKTRA.text: Love this place! Only had one bad experience but I think it's cause there was a newbie making the drinks! Queso dip is good, LOVE their pork sandwich and their fries are awesome!

bkYdxBEWlLpJfq1TYXdX4g.text: Very tasty meal. Order the beef brisket (mixed with both lean and fatty meat)! It's so delicious and oh so filling too! The ambience is very casual inside. There are booths and floor seating as well as a bar. Decorations are eclectic and exude an air of laissez faire in the face of eccentricity. Our servers were kind and wordy but not pushy. As I was from out of town (out of the country actually) I asked for the public wifi password, but that was unfortunately given to me incorrectly so I was stuck off the grid for the duration of the meal. About 10 minutes after our order was taken we were given our meals, rather more promptly than I expected (kudos to the pre-prepping work). With both our meals came pickled onions and hushpuppies. I had never had hushpuppies before, and I would say for my fellow Canadians who do not frequent the south, they are similar in texture and taste to Tim Hortons old fashioned donuts, without the glaze of course. I ate them with ketchup (which I don't with donuts I might add) and every bite was heavenly; reminded me of home - walking out the door in the blustery dawn, not a soul stirs in the frigid street, only sound heard was made by the crunching of my boots along the freshly fallen snow - I hope my car starts up today. It did and I race through the frozen tundra down the street to my neighbourhood Tim's and order a large double double with my favourite treat: that subtly sweet, dry but my not crumbling yet melt in your mouth pastry, the old fashioned donut.

1fLCI8aXoK0tPgtSp58RBQ.text: Love, love the BBQ. Food is tasty. Service is excellent. Efficient and friendly. Melissa's recommendation on a craft beer that paired with the food was right on target.

x4IWOtzNtmXrmBI3PDnOoA.text: I love some good BBQ so I definitely had to stop here when I was passing by. We were seated immediately and the service was great. I ordered the pulled pork. The pork was good but their sauces were really the star here. Both were tasty. I'll be going back if I ever want some BBQ.

YfCDsiD-4piwU3s6rjun-w.text: I came with some friends on a weekend for dinner, and even at around 5 PM, the place was already starting to fill up.  Thankfully, we got a table for the 8 of us.    I ordered the burnt tips, since the description on the menu sounded so promising.  I ordered it with bacon wrapped jalepenos and baked beans as sides.  I got the large portion, but was a little disappointed at how small of an amount of meat it seemed to be.  But even placing that issue aside, the quality of the meat was disappointing.  I mean, burnt tips are my favorite part of brisket - I love the smokiness and depth of flavor the burnt-ness adds to the meat.  Therefore, I thought a whole plate of it would be heaven for me.  Maybe it's the fact that too much of a good thing can be a bad thing - Joey needs Monica just like awesome burnt tips need regular brisket.  They balance each other out.  Or maybe it's that my tips were chewy, dry, and at times hard to eat.  Regardless, I wasn't a fan of burnt tips on their own, and I wouldn't recommend getting it.  Joey just couldn't sustain his own show, right?  Oh, and there were only 3 bacon wrapped jalepenos (which tasted good) and the baked beans were just ok.   My wife got the pulled pork barbecue with a side of smoked veggies.  The barbecue was dry and so-so in flavoring.  It definitely needed the sauce to make it taste better.  And the veggies were not bad.  Our service was pretty friendly and fast, and they did a good job accommodating our table of 6 adults and 2 children.  I was just a bit underwhelmed by the food that we got.  It seemed like the friends we ate with enjoyed their ribs, though.  So maybe next time, that's what I'll try.

NU_aDpzc7fMRpuoqN4iWPQ.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of dining here on Sunday and we both were extremely pleased! First, our server, Matt, was exceptional! He was without a doubt the most informative server that I have ever come across in my nearly 50 years of dining out. Matt explained to us about the smoker, the whiskey, the brisket, the different sauces, just everything! He was awesome! He even brought us out a sample of brisket and the sauces to try out to help us decide on what to order. The brisket was phenomenal and my husband went with ordering the fatty style brisket and added on the burnt ends. He shared, of course, and OMG! Heaven in your mouth! Best brisket I have ever eaten! Definitely order the fatty brisket as it will literally melt in your mouth! I ordered a rack of ribs and they were the best ribs that I have had since moving to NC three years ago, and we have tried many, many ribs down here! I shared as well and STILL brought home enough for us to have lunch the next day! The ribs were soooo good that you do not even need any sauce but I did still dip a few in because their sauces are delish too! I couldn't decide which sauce I liked better so Matt brought me all 4 on the side! How cool is that!!! For dessert we split a banana pudding and it was fantastic! The texture was more like a fluffy mousse and it was so creamy and yummy! Just thinking about it is making my mouth water! This please was off the hook fantastic and we will definitely make this our go-to barbecue place!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

Rkm82Dn2zFtdDfVV3ttr4w.text: Midwood Smokehouse opened its second location on May 7, 2015 in the Ballantyne neighborhood of Charlotte. It's in the old Sticky Fingers Smokehouse space at Toringdon Circle (shopping center). I visited this restaurant a couple weeks after it opened with a group of friends, two of whom make up two-thirds of the Barbecue Bros (barbecuebros.co). We ordered a nice sampling of BBQ and enjoyed the experience. The food and service were good. At 5:45pm on a Friday, the restaurant was already very busy. We were told by the hostess that our wait would be about 30 minutes. We were seated in about 20. There wasn't much space at the bar so we waited outside with others. By the time we left around 7:15pm, the number of folks waiting had grown quite large. There must've been at least a half-dozen groups/families waiting. The inside of the restaurant resembles an American restaurant chain such as Applebee's or Ruby Tuesday. The clean, open space features both a bar and dining room with a mixture of booths and tables. Our group of six sat in one of the circular bench-style booths by the windows. The interior sports several large TVs (great for watching sports), vintage North Carolina artwork and memorabilia, and artistic metal cutouts with a BBQ, farm, and kitchen theme. I haven't been to Midwood Smokehouse's original location in Plaza Midwood, but I was told by my tablemates that that location is different in look and feel. This location in Ballantyne is designed for the suburbs. There's plenty of parking too. The BBQ served here is influenced from various styles from the Carolinas to Texas. Aside from the standard sandwiches and plates, Midwood Smokehouse also serves salads, tacos, and appetizers like Pimento Cheese Fries, Fried Pickles, and Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos. Expect to spend about $8-10 each for most sandwiches (includes a side) and about $10-18 each for most plates. Plates come in both small and large sizes. We went with the following: BBQ: * Burnt Ends (small, $13.50) - crispy caramelized cubes of brisket tossed in a housemade Fat Tire BBQ sauce * Combo Platter ("Well-Fed," $22), which came with: * Carolina Chopped Pork - hickory-smoked chopped pork lightly dressed in Eastern NC vinegar sauce * Beef Brisket (both fatty and lean) - Texas-style sliced beef brisket served in natural juices * Smoked Sausage - combination of beef, pork, and garlic * Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs (dry) - smoked Apps & Sides: * Hushpuppies (whole basket, $5) - scratch-made, slightly sweet and warm, served with BBQ sauce * Collard Greens * Classic Mac & Cheese * BBQ Slaw I liked everything. The food had simple presentation and was served in old-fashioned plates and bowls with floral decorations akin to something you'd expect to find at your grandma's house. The Burnt Ends were rather tender and flavorful. They were more tender than I was expecting. A good bit of sauce, flavor (sweetness), and caramelization. These were probably my favorite of the BBQ meats. The Carolina Chopped Pork was on par with other chopped pork I've had around the state. Moist and tasty, the meat was smoked with hickory logs from North Carolina. You have the option of ordering the Beef Brisket fatty, lean, or both. We got both and the brisket was delectable. Smoky with an appetizing chew and consistency. The Smoked Sausage was A-OK. Plump and glistening, it was charred on one side and had firm texture and bite. The Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs were excellent. Near "fall off the bone," the somewhat fatty meat and rub were packed with delicious flavor. Note the ribs are available with sauce as well. BBQ sauces at the table included South Carolina Mustard, Eastern NC Vinegar, Midwood Signature, and Habanero. My favorite was the subtly sweet Midwood Signature, but really, none of the BBQ needed any sauce. The meats tasted fine without it. The Hushpuppies were small and soft, almost squishy. They weren't crispy nor crunchy, but had comparatively smooth centers. The Collards, with bits of pork, were alright as was the BBQ Slaw. When it comes to slaw, you can order both mayo-based "Coleslaw" or the NC traditional vinegar-based "BBQ Slaw" (a.k.a. red slaw), finely chopped. The Mac & Cheese was great. Made with elbow macaroni, it was nice and cheesy with small, chewy bits of hardened, charred cheese. It was moderately oily, but lots of good mac 'n cheese are greasy. Service was terrific. Our orders came out in a reasonable amount of time and I was impressed with how our server remembered our food and drink orders after we'd changed our minds and switched them up on her. Kudos. Founder/owner Frank Scibelli personally checked on our table. Midwood Smokehouse plans to open more locations including one in Columbia, SC. If you like BBQ, these guys are worth checking out.

PtBRLsfG9gtGpe8KEviqMg.text: If you are looking for BBQ with a nice staff, good atmosphere and a chain kind of feel this is the place. Let me explain- I'm used to BBQ places that are a bit less clean, styrofoam cups, white bread, etc... This place had great BBQ with a Longhorn steakhouse kind of feel. Was very clean, manager stopped by twice to make sure we were ok and our server was awesome.  Get the Pimento Cheese Fries- you won't be sorry...   Really good stop for me and the family. We will be back next time we are in Charlotte!

uHIXGdXRQsaL_nWpOhm36w.text: Apparently, Obama and Hilary beat me to this place.  I got here though and when I did, I had the chopped salad topped with burnt brisket tips. I also tried the Bramble - which is a cocktail made with blackberry moonshine. Both were delicious! I went with a group so this was a table of 7 and service was pretty good - there were no long delays and our drinks were refilled as expected.   Would definitely return!

UbIjct8QEBBNU42GvbjEDQ.text: This is my first time at The Ballantyne location. I have to say it's so much easier to get in and out of then my usual location on Central Avenue. Parking is so much easier too. The size and seating here is much roomier and more accommodating for different size dining parties. A hostess greeted me immediately and the waitress appeared as soon as I sat down. I found my favorite chopped pork salad to be just as delicious here. I still think it's odd they don't have crackers or bread available with their salads.

sy2GJLoqxCWImgmGidJDPg.text: The brisket is on point! Best ever. Make sure to ask for the spicy sauce (it's in the back) the general manager is customer focused always out walking around asking customers about their experience and helping the staff.

9GGvoE9UoTCHozmbTO8m6A.text: Although not strictly a "Carolina-style" Barbecue restaurant this is a great BBQ place with something for everyone and excellent food and drinks overall. While the pulled pork is good, the ribs, brisket and sausage here is also excellent and if you are going as a group you should order a "Pig Out" platter where you can choose 4 different meats. Beverage program includes cocktails made with local moonshine and as well as a comprehensive wine list. Be sure to try the banana pudding, the pecan cobbler (served warm) and the chocolate mousse pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped jalapeño
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Moonshine shots

JRmPJIyuqD67GnMrJkerYw.text: This was my first BBQ experience, so I'm not an expert but... it was sooo gooooddddddd. Maybe it's not as authentic as like, a shack in the woods or something but since I have no experience to compare it to, I just have to say, it was great.  Hot, tasty, reasonably priced, and a fun atmosphere.  This is for the south Charlotte location. First, it was already super busy on a Saturday night and they let us book a reservation about 40 minutes before we got there. The table was waiting for us when we arrived. Our server was friendly, attentive, and happily answered 20 questions from a bbq newbie (me).  He brought us a bunch of extra sauces and always kept our drinks filled.  The (beef) burnt ends were amazing, and it seems like each entree is enough for two people.  Mac & cheese, the bomb.  The food came out fast, but not so fast that we couldn't finish our appetizer first. 100% will go again.

PEB6dFXGt59ZK9214L4ejA.text: Very happy with this BBQ. Highly recommend getting the Brisket, Hushpuppies and BBQ Beans.   Service is exceptional and prices are some of the best.   Definitely coming back here next time I'm in North Carolina!!!

_LYanBtqhdprfSK1y_I2AQ.text: I've been to the Midwood Smokehouse's original location in Plaza Midwood but with the help of my dinner group, we met at this new location because parking is easier.   They took over an old Sticky Fingers location so it has the feel of a family style restaurant rather than the funkiness of the original location.  Our server indicated she was new and she did well despite some challenges. She knew the rotating beer selections which was plus. She told us at first they were out of ribs but then asked how many of us wanted ribs and went back into the kitchen to see how many were available and we were in luck. So a big plus for that.   But parts of the service fell flat. The first part goes to the bar staff.  3 of us ordered the same beer, NoDa's Ramble on Red. Another person arrived later and ordered a Stella and her beer arrived almost immediately.  We waiting close to 30 minutes for the NoDa beers. It was almost like they had to drive up to NoDa and pick up another keg. Thanks to our server for at least following up with them a few times.   Another flaw came with the ordering. One person at our table ordered their meal with cole slaw and sweet potato fries as their sides and they brought out two sides of the fries. After notifying two servers, there were then almost duplicates of cole slaw. So the wait staff seems a bit frazzled here. Is everyone new??  As for food, I had the ribs and they were tender and sauced just right with additional sauce for dipping.  The mac n cheese was amazing! The hush puppies were a bit dry and hard.  So I'd come here for the food but you might want to stick with soft drinks until the bar staff gets their act together.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs with Mac n cheese

lpZ0kUPge3lLSwhU8T07KQ.text: Wow...this place is great! I found my new favorite bbq restaurant in Charlotte. Don't even know where to begin. Not only was all the food amazing, but so were their drinks. Awesome selection of whiskeys and craft beers. We ordered the pig out and added burnt ends. All the beats ere cooked perfectly with delicious sauces. I will be returning frequently.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

m5oyT8-D7WUlCSo07mUPOw.text: Maybe it's the location but I did not enjoy this go around at the Johnston location. We had to ask for each sauce, rather than all coming out at the same time... And the $30 rib was mostly fat. Don't think I'll be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. More fat than meat

R4lPiuLe1iSH_ntqHaKrHQ.text: Audriann is the most awful waitress ever! She needs to be fired. My boyfriend and I are visiting Charlotte from Philly and were really excited to eat at Midwood but she ruined the ENTIRE experience. She does not need to be in customer service. She started off being very rude to us from the time we sat down. We switched tables because it was too cold and her exact words to greet us was "let's try this again, my name is "Audrey" and I'm gonna be your server." Well it only got worst from there. I ordered Sprite to drink, which tasted like Seltzer water so I asked her to please change it. She told me this is the only sprite we have so do you want something else - clearly Audrey. Clearly. We asked for meal recommendations (it's our first time here!) and she said "well everything is good, I can't recommend any one thing over another." Oh ok Audrey. Thanks! . After ordering, not once did she check on us. My boyfriend had to go ask someone else for a refill bc who knows where she was. The food was OK, which is another reason for this poor review. The fries were cold. The mac and cheese was hard and cold. The brisket was dry. The hushpuppies were awesome though. Nevertheless, do better Audrey! Do better Midwood!

0B_AtEHteA1TguoELFAIiw.text: This is a great location of a really cool restaurant concept. The location on Johnston is never crowded and much more mellow than the plaza location. We like to stop in here for lunch, especially when we have out of town guests. Their Bbq is great and they have excellent drink specials. We came on Easter Sunday and I ordered a Bloody Mary (3 dollars off on Sunday). I've had consistently good service here. I love to get the chopped salad and add BBQ salmon. There are choices on the menu for everyone. I LOVE their jalapeno mule, it's a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy Bloody Mary
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork, mac and cheese, and sweet potato fries
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chopped salad with BBQ salmon

VYthWn-Kf1O2Vp5DDOkftQ.text: Not as good as before. Been to this location and the other ones a few times, but this time disappointed. I knew right away with the unfriendly hostess, that acted like we were an inconvenience that something was amiss.  Then just ok food - real quick, but luke warm, like it was just sitting in back pre- cooked. Plus, skimpy on pours, like the bartender just wants to empty the  remaining part of the bottle and not open a new one? Being cheap doesn't impress customers, just has them go to the next place. It is not like you have good prices? So if service or attitude is not good why patronize? Staff and manager just going through the motions, they walk around but no focus on customers.

qRxyRhGxR-zN41uO0XRgxA.text: Always enjoy the food and the service is always great! The brisket is the best! And the sides are generous.

-V52XTHDpSOOsMpuaqEQ5w.text: I'm a regular, and Midwood typically has great food and great service. Today, I had the displeasure of encountering a bartender that I've never met. A short headed guy with a tasty attitude. I was there 10 minutes and all he did was complain about how busy he was. Who  wants to spend their lunch hour around such a nasty and negative person? I didn't even eat. I'm writing this review while walking in to City BBQ.

JaUnROAV16_5i4xAPFaDBQ.text: Absolutely love this place. Never can go wrong. From liquor selection and food amazing.  They sell out of things so make sure you get there around 6-6:30 when they are not busy. Selling out is a good sign food is fresh and tasty. Great prices as well.

_DjO3n8AlOD8wl9E-3bZjQ.text: Some of the BEST barbecue I have EVER had. Simply delicious! Sweet potato fries, hush puppies and macaroni and cheese were awesome! Great service, atmosphere and food!!! I'll be back soon!

7fHhnF-M_BqS2gF9ayDftQ.text: I had the grilled cheese, Mac and cheese and BBQ queso. The BBQ queso is my favoirte. I've ordered a few times in door dash. The chips are perfectly crispy but not too hard. The queso with BBQ is an amazing combination and both saved pretty well as leftovers.

QA7WURLgJxJhziQ7W-KQhQ.text: Good BBQ!! The Pulled pork is Carolina style with some vinegar in it, but the wood flavor is still strong and tasty. Between the portion of meat and the 2 sides AND hush puppies, it's 2meals worth of food. The sauces are great, try the habenero bbq sauce for a little kick.

j_wOpIIMX0Z1yVL9TV0RhA.text: I read an article that said this place had great BBQ before visiting Charlotte so I thought I would give it a try!  The place  This is their new location that opened not too long ago.  It was your average chain looking place plenty of parking and nice on the inside but nothing special.  Very clean which is a big plus with me.  The food  I ordered the ribs and they were good but nothing special.  I was really hoping for better but they were nothing to write home about.  I heard that the original place is better so maybe next time I will try their other location. My sides again were solid but nothing special.  The service We had a group of 10 and our waitress was great she was very kind and attentive.    The verdict  I really had high hopes since reading this place had great BBQ since it is my favorite type of food.  I was disappointed when it was nothing great.  I would come here again but don't except anything above the average chain.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs hush puppies and baked beans!

ivXktFkwLuoXybekR0RObQ.text: This place has a good selection of BBQ meats and types of dishes.  I have eaten several. My favorites so far are the Burnt Ends, beef brisket ends, with great smoked flavor.  Also the St Louis baby back ribs Just melt in your mouth.  The sides provide option depending on whether you feel like southern cuisine or not.    The service is outstanding. Attentive and responsive. Great recommendations. Whether you sit at the bar or in a booth.    They stock great beers and bourbons. What more could you ask?  Friendly patrons. Comfortable atmosphere.   Cheers!

m5fR_pmccQb5Do6O7wAvCA.text: Visited about eight times so far. Pretty good BBQ, but it's a hit or miss. I like burned ends or their brisket. There were times when meat came out cold or all just fat, but overall not bad and I keep coming back since it's so close to my work and everyone is really nice there.

LF311n_TzvajpeBar_07gw.text: Midwood BBQ Bar was suggested to us as it is quickly becoming a BBQ institution in Charlotte. We had the pleasure of dining there at their Ballyntyne location on New Years Day for dinner.   North Carolina and Charlotte in general have a lot of BBQ restauarants. Most are very average. Some pulled chicken or pork smothered in copious amounts of some mysterious red sauce so you can't even tell if the meat was actually good ! That is NOT the case here at Midwood. For starters they only use hickory wood to smoke their meats in a one of a kind old school manual commercial smoker.  Someone has to feed the smoker constantly to keep the fire going and maintain a even temperature in the smoker at all times. That takes a lot of work . More art than science and it shows in their food.We started with some smoked wings. dry on the outside but moist and flavorful inside. My daughter chose the kids pulled pork sandwich w/sweet potato fries. She loved it ! They have a wonderful taco selection {yup, tacos at a BBQ spot !} You have a choice of 3 . All were fresh and yummy. The baked mac and cheese disappeared promptly also ! I had a new years special that is not normally on their menu. Pork shoulder , collards and black eyed peas. All for good luck to start 2017. Their extensive cocktail and bourbon/whisky list made a choice rather difficult. My hubby kept it classically simple with a Makers Mark 46 and Ginger Ale.   Service was prompt, informative and friendly. The manager demanded we try some brisket before we departed , so we managed to try a few bites. WOW ! tender, tasty and perfect mix of lean and fat.Midwood is now our "GO TO " spot when we are in Charlotte and craving REAL BBQ !

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Traditional NYE entree
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos

44ftpry9uIobkBNcXOIFCA.text: I like Midwood Smokehouse usually go to Plaza Midwood. The service at this location was really poor. The food came first asked the waitress for water and never got it. In fact never came at all for a drink order. We ate our dinner without a beverage other than leftover from the bar.   She finally came to our table after dinner was complete. I asked why we never got a drink period and she said she'd get a manager. Just a real "BITCH"!  We had an angry exchange. The manager was trying to be helpful but the damage was done. If she worked for me I would have fired her on the spot! Absolutely awful. My grandson knows the owner and I will write to him to make him aware. Really bad experience!

yZduaS7FA_ZpowJSeVxINQ.text: While service is inconsistent, don't expect everything to go smooth the barbecue was terrific. We had a group of 7 and after a 39 min Friday night wait, we were seated.  Plenty of room at the table. The barbecue was terrific. Everyone left satisfied keep working on the service as it was disorganized and a little embarrassing to our guests.

gq0UsHeZgj1eCZ0LjyhCJg.text: The best.  A chicken and big sides for $10.50?? Seriously. Wow!!  So awesome.  Amazing flavors.  Never a down meal.   Easy to do takeout like me too.  Favorite dive.  Love it.

prTQIADa2uXA1vRITShj4Q.text: I have to admit.... We went in on a Saturday (first thing) and we were expecting great things! Unfortunately, our waitress was clearly pre-occupied or simply untrained - the place was NOT busy and almost immediate after taking our first bites, she placed the check on the table. What?!? We actually wanted dessert! But ok, fair enough, we'll pass on dessert..... She saw we still had food on our plates about 10 mins in and she asked if we wanted boxes. I thought for sure that I was on a hidden camera show... Are you kidding me? She tried to offer a box for our toddler and almost took his half eaten food away to clear the table. How bizarre!!! The place wasn't packed with tables waiting either - it wasn't even noon. We were so put off that we were rushed out that we can guarantee we won't be back for quite sometime. Waiting tables is NOT about rushing customers out the door. I was disappointed and can only hope this young woman gets coached - tips and "regulars" come from good service AND good food. Not one OR the other.

BUIyqev40Slhnr7DZa1Ccw.text: Omg...everything was amazing.  Between two of us we had pulled pork, sweet potatoe fries, mac and cheese, brisket taco, and pulled chicken taco. Everything was amazing.  Even the sweet potato fries,  which are almost always good,  were perfection. Tacos were amazing with just the right amount of spice. Accompanying slaw was excellent and unusual.  Pulled pork was taken to new levels with their pickled onions and pepper vinegar.  Yum.

eLfDLzCKr_PVTaLA5J6yEg.text: Food was great, loved the ambiance-- great music! Cameron took great care of us- his service was awesome. My family and I will definitely be back.

VQ2rUUM9_OKtn9ku1oZLwQ.text: Restaurant closed tonight for a corporate event for Met Life.  #lame

JvTPKje1KBR3APnTJD0Ugw.text: The burn ends looks very ugly,like black rocks on a plate. But it tastes very good! Crispy outter layer and juicy inside. Worth to try! The side of creamy corn is also very good!

3p8WJ-4_QlTx2lD7IGVWbw.text: First time giving these guys a try and I LOVED it! Shantel was our server for lunch today and she killed it. She was friendly, efficient and above all very knowledgeable about the products. She brought us out small sides of each of the sauces to try and, though I liked the mustard the best, they are all great.

hje5H6e85SSMj24DuSmZJA.text: I'm sad today. What was once my mainstay for BBQ in Charlotte is no more. Perhaps it's the challenge of repeating on a larger scale that which is successful on a smaller scale. Who knows. But it seems like the flavor of the food has taken a back seat to having it served quickly.   The ribs were simply bland. Same for the chicken. This from the one place where you could always order anything dry knowing that the flavor of the rub and smoke would shine through. Not so today.   On top of that, there aren't any bottles of BBQ sauce on the table to sample from. You have to ask for it and they basically have only three sauces (regular, vinegar and mustard).   Maybe I'll need to go back to the original location on Central. I'm hoping that they bring back the flavor. Even if it means a longer wait.

TyLKkGQesBPqo_qIWIjJgg.text: Bit of a wait even with call ahead but the food was very good.  Build your own salad was fresh and full of the add ins we picked.  Smoked chicken was excellent - tender, juicy puled chicken.  We will be back again.

7fFOY-G0SxtC9TmGVT-C7Q.text: When you walk in to a Southern BBQ joint and see a review from Time Out New York, you know you're in for a treat. Be sure to get your soul food fix if you're in the Southern Charlotte area!

rwSoY-WVQmmiNZF3P2Z7kw.text: This place is the absolute best place! Definitely recommend it as one of the best places in Charlotte.

NSuqqtdATVE4V-sjedTMcg.text: This was my second, and likely last, visit to this restaurant.  On my first visit last year, I ordered a half-chicken.  It was burnt on the outside, fairly dry on the inside, and really did not have much taste.  Tonight I tried to get my standard order when I visit a barbecue restaurant:  a sliced bbq sandwich with hush puppies.  Much to my surprise, the restaurant does not serve sliced bbq.  Really?  This is NC, the self-proclaimed bbq capital of the South.  I realize that most folks prefer their bbq chopped.  That said, this is the first bbq restaurant that I have EVER been to in NC that didn't have sliced bbq as an option.  What a disappointment! So, I ordered the chopped chicken bbq plate, which came with one side and hush-puppies.  Just like my last visit, the chicken was dry and had very little flavor.  Even the SC version of mustard-bbq sauce that came with it could not save the chicken.  The five miniature-sized hush-puppies that came with the meal were bland and basically tasteless.  The only redeeming feature of the meal was the macaroni and cheese that I ordered as my side dish.  It was quite good.  Also of note was my server who provided excellent service.  But despite the server and the macaroni and cheese, I will pass this restaurant by the next time I am in South Charlotte and get a hankering for bbq.

aYiJzvghnVq6cH49cTirxQ.text: I was sad the day we moved to the suburbs. I've lived uptown for years and moving to south Charlotte made me feel like I was barrel aging and buying strollers. But that all changed when Midwood opened here. As good as ever and all the charm and culture is here too. The meats are all fantastic and they have great craft drinks too! We get takeout from here on late work nights.

aSsUKOgfQkW8LJRHdOe2vA.text: A great addition to South Charlotte.  Excellent food.  The pork is eastern NC style, which is not my preference, but everything else is so good. There are not many places that serve burnt ends, and it's worth going to Midwood just for that. Their smoked wings are really good, and the banana pudding is delicious.  The only problem is that it gets crowded and there is a wait during peak hours, but what else would you expect?

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small combo platter
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Wings
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pudding

ZWK9dn6meiC44g_qoDKufw.text: The aroma, music and vibe were excellent, during this very busy lunch time visit.  The food and beer all came out within a reasonable amount of time, and the wait staff were friendly, even those rushed and being trained.  The pulled-pork with super tasty and warm - pink coloured, with a smokey undertone and NOT at all dry. The coleslaw and hush-puppies were a little too sweet for my liking, but each had a good crunch and good texture. Unfortunately I did not get enough BBQ source, (a bigger dish please) nor were they any to taste test on the tables.  The OMB Copper was ably poured by the bar staff and tasted wonderfully fresh and crisp. It could have done with being a fuller pint!  I am looking forward to returning. Easily the best BBQ in south Charlotte.

1y0iFwvbcgeYE_veE8oOUQ.text: The back of the house deserves a better front of the house representing them. I've visited multiple times and it seems to be the same routine....great food/angry servers. I'm not sure why. Maybe I'm just unlucky

lWMiIjaPa_FebToiOXlyOg.text: Combine queso cheese and pulled pork / brisket with chips for an appetizer and you're off to a great start, just hope you are still hungry for the main course! Brisket was so tender, it fell apart with a fork; I would however suggest the lean form brisket option as the *some fat* option was mostly that, fat. Would recommend overall.

F8Az3r9TP6qKcZ7iYPyLTg.text: Over-rated . Noisy. Mediocre service.  The chicken and ribs were dried out and not hot enough. My wife's burger was over cooked and tasteless. But the smoked veggies were excellent.  Won't be going back.

_K0aLoDX22XNwisOSXxkCA.text: This was my first time trying southern BBQ. And it was AMAZING. I got burnt ends, Mac and cheese & hushpuppies. Everything was delightful. I also sampled everyone else's BBQ at my table and none of it was disappointing. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for great BBQ!

5B8ZMZ3Qu-JRo0vjcuyGFQ.text: Still consistently the best BBQ I've tasted.  Whenever someone comes to visit, we always take them here, it's a hit everytime. The takeout option is always the best option when it's busy.  We ordered from here on a busy Saturday night recently and it was 20 minutes from the time we ordered the food until it was time for pickup.  I waltzed in, bypassed all the folks waiting for talbes, went to the Take-Out area on the right of bar,  paid, and walked out with my food.  It took longer for me to park than it did to get the food.  This is a staple in the "list of restaurants to take guests to".  Keep up the good work.

i4h58FlLFmGC02yOVWVk6w.text: Midwood was close to my hotel and I wanted to see what Carolina Barbeque is all about. Let's just say that I took a few bites of the ribs and decided it best that I just leave them alone and chuck it up to a loss...I'll stick with the "q" in L.A.  Disappointed.

FQTyx2awweA9-huXg9uDgg.text: I have never eaten at a smokehouse before. Now I know what I have been missing.   Kaz was an excellent server.  Very friendly and fast. Love the music and the decor.   Will come back again soon.  Had the ribs. The burnt end brisket.  Excellent.   They also have tv s to watch sports and a nice bar.

x7bpYGEZcNcPNcDrtkSn4g.text: Excellent. A bit pricey when you look at the menu but portions were great and everything cooked well. The burnt ends were excellent and the full rack of ribs were a True full rack.

WtFIZUju4w5YK-4nUpkWHg.text: Decent food but not traditional bar b que.  They took some short cuts with the burnt ends.

W0o_01R1XLW2gh7Yesg13w.text: Midwood has been the talk at my church so I decided to give it a try.  I'm originally from Texas so expectations were high.  I was promptly greeted as I walked in and I must say, I loved the vibe.  First impression was very good.  Out of the gate the service was on top of it.  Quick to say hello, welcome me, and even gave me a tour of the menu and some insightful knowledge into their smoking process.  I loved hearing that their smoker was custom made out of Mesquite, TX.  This must be the real deal.  I had to try the brisket as it's a hometown staple.  I have to say it brought me back.  I fell in love with Midwood at that point.  Service A+, Food A++.  Nice job Midwood.  See you again real soon.

TwRkEmnZUeNBtNff4DCzOA.text: Just ate at the new Midwood Smokehouse in Ballantyne.  (I have always heard how great Midwood Smokehouse is, but never had a chance to check it out all the way on Central Avenue.)  The Ballantyne location is soooo convenient for me!  I have already had lunch there twice and dinner once.  Try the brisket and pulled pork!  Honestly, the best brisket I have ever had!  Service and management were very friendly and attentive.   I do a lot of business in the Ballantyne area and feel that I can trust these guys to take care of me.  Keep on doing it right, Midwood!
